CHAPTER XVIII . [THE INVISIBLE MAN SLEEPS

Exhausted and wounded]105-the invisible man as [the Invisible Man]150-the invisible man was , [he]150-the invisible man refused to accept [Kemp]121-kemp s word that [his]121-kemp freedom should be respected . [He]150-the invisible man examined the two windows of [the bedroom]1009-the bedroom , drew up the blinds and opened the sashes , to confirm [Kemp]121-kemp s statement that a retreat by [them]1010-them would be possible . Outside the night was very quiet and still , and the new moon was setting over the down . Then [he]121-kemp examined the keys of [the bedroom]1009-the bedroom and the two dressing - room doors , to satisfy [himself]121-kemp that these also could be made an assurance of freedom . Finally [he]121-kemp expressed [himself]121-kemp satisfied . [He]121-kemp stood on the hearth rug and [Kemp]121-kemp heard the sound of a yawn .

" [I]150-the invisible man m sorry , "[150-the invisible man] said [the Invisible Man]150-the invisible man , " if [I]150-the invisible man can not tell [you]121-kemp all that [I]150-the invisible man have done to - night . But [I]150-the invisible man am worn out . It s grotesque , no doubt . It s horrible ! But believe [me]150-the invisible man , [Kemp]121-kemp , in spite of [your]121-kemp arguments of this morning , it is quite a possible thing . [I]150-the invisible man have made a discovery . [I]150-the invisible man meant to keep it to [myself]150-the invisible man . [I]150-the invisible man can t. [I]150-the invisible man must have [a partner]1699-a partner . And [you]121-kemp .... [We]1700-we can do such things ... But to - morrow . Now , [Kemp]121-kemp , [I]150-the invisible man feel as though [I]150-the invisible man must sleep or perish . "[150-the invisible man]

[Kemp]121-kemp stood in the middle of [the room]1421-the room staring at the headless garment . " [I]121-kemp suppose [I]121-kemp must leave [you]121-kemp , "[121-kemp] [he]121-kemp said . " It s incredible . Three things happening like this , overturning all [my]121-kemp preconceptions would make [me]121-kemp insane . But it s real ! Is there anything more that [I]121-kemp can get [you]121-kemp ? "[121-kemp]

" Only bid [me]131-griffin good - night , "[131-griffin] said [Griffin]131-griffin .

" Good - night , "[121-kemp] said [Kemp]121-kemp , and shook an invisible hand . [He]121-kemp walked sideways to the door . Suddenly the dressing - gown walked quickly towards [him]121-kemp . " Understand [me]1014-the dressing - gown ! "[1014-the dressing - gown] said [the dressing - gown]1014-the dressing - gown . " No attempts to hamper [me]1014-the dressing - gown , or capture [me]1014-the dressing - gown ! Or "[1014-the dressing - gown]

[Kemp]121-kemp s face changed a little . " [I]121-kemp thought [I]121-kemp gave [you]121-kemp [my]121-kemp word , "[121-kemp] [he]121-kemp said .

[Kemp]121-kemp closed the door softly behind [him]121-kemp , and the key was turned upon [him]121-kemp forthwith . Then , as [he]121-kemp stood with an expression of passive amazement on [his]121-kemp face , the rapid feet came to the door of [the dressing - room]1015-the dressing - room and that too was locked . [Kemp]121-kemp slapped [his]121-kemp brow with [his]121-kemp hand . " Am [I]121-kemp dreaming ? Has [the world]547-the world gone mad or have [I]121-kemp ? "[121-kemp]

[He]121-kemp laughed , and put [his]121-kemp hand to the locked door . " Barred out of [[my]121-kemp own bedroom]1702-my own bedroom , by a flagrant absurdity ! "[121-kemp] [he]121-kemp said .

[He]121-kemp walked to the head of the staircase , turned , and stared at the locked doors . " It s fact , "[121-kemp] [he]121-kemp said . [He]121-kemp put [his]121-kemp fingers to [his]121-kemp slightly bruised neck . " Undeniable fact ![121-kemp]

" But "[121-kemp]

[He]121-kemp shook [his]121-kemp head hopelessly , turned , and went [downstairs]377-downstairs .

[He]121-kemp lit the dining - room lamp , got out a cigar , and began pacing [the room]1421-the room , ejaculating . Now and then [he]121-kemp would argue with [himself]121-kemp .

" Invisible ! "[121-kemp] [he]121-kemp said .

" Is there such a thing as an invisible animal ? ... In [the sea]1703-the sea , yes . Thousands millions . [All the larvae]1704-all the larvae , all the little nauplii and tornarias , all the microscopic things , the jelly - fish . In [the sea]1703-the sea there are more things invisible than visible ! [I]121-kemp never thought of that before . And in [the ponds]1706-the ponds too ! All those little pond - life things specks of colourless translucent jelly ! But in air ? No ![121-kemp]

" It can t be .[121-kemp]

" But after all why not ?[121-kemp]

" If [a man]1463-a man was made of glass [he]1463-a man would still be visible . "[121-kemp]

[His]121-kemp meditation became profound . The bulk of three cigars had passed into the invisible or diffused as a white ash over the carpet before [he]121-kemp spoke again . Then it was merely an exclamation . [He]121-kemp turned aside , walked out of [the room]1421-the room , and went into [[his]121-kemp little consulting - room]1019-his little consulting - room and lit the gas there . It was [a little room]1020-a little room , because [Dr. Kemp]121-kemp did not live by practice , and in [it]1020-a little room were the day s newspapers . The morning s paper lay carelessly opened and thrown aside . [He]121-kemp caught it up , turned it over , and read the account of a " Strange Story from [Iping]4-iping "[121-kemp] that [the mariner at [Port Stowe]16-port stowe]1021-the mariner at port stowe had spelt over so painfully to [Mr. Marvel]73-mr. marvel . [Kemp]121-kemp read it swiftly .

" Wrapped up ! "[121-kemp] said [Kemp]121-kemp . " [Disguised]0-disguised ! Hiding it ! [No one]248-no one seems to have been aware of [his]73-mr. marvel misfortune . What the devil _ is _ [his]73-mr. marvel game ? "[121-kemp]

[He]121-kemp dropped the paper , and [his]121-kemp eye went seeking . " Ah ! "[121-kemp] [he]121-kemp said , and caught up the _ St. James Gazette _ , lying folded up as it arrived . " Now [we]1709-we shall get at the truth , "[121-kemp] said [Dr. Kemp]121-kemp . [He]121-kemp rent the paper open ; a couple of columns confronted [him]121-kemp . " [An Entire Village in [Sussex]25-sussex]1710-an entire village in sussex goes Mad "[121-kemp] was the heading .

" Good Heavens ! "[121-kemp] said [Kemp]121-kemp , reading eagerly an incredulous account of the events in Iping , of the previous afternoon , that have already been described . Over the leaf the report in the morning paper had been reprinted .

[He]121-kemp re - read it . " Ran through [the streets]1711-the streets striking right and left . Jaffers insensible . [Mr. Huxter]80-mr. huxter in great pain still unable to describe what [he]73-mr. marvel saw . Painful humiliation vicar . [Woman ill with terror]1712-woman ill with terror ! Windows smashed . This extraordinary story probably a fabrication . Too good not to print _ cum grano _ ! "[121-kemp]

[He]121-kemp dropped the paper and stared blankly in front of [him]121-kemp . " Probably a fabrication ! "[121-kemp]

[He]121-kemp caught up the paper again , and re - read the whole business . " But when does [the Tramp]1713-the tramp come in ? Why [the deuce]1714-the deuce was [he]1713-the tramp chasing [a tramp]1715-a tramp ? "[121-kemp]

[He]121-kemp sat down abruptly on the surgical bench . " [He]1713-the tramp s not only invisible , "[121-kemp] [he]121-kemp said , " but [he]1713-the tramp s mad ! Homicidal ! "[121-kemp]

When dawn came to mingle its pallor with the lamp - light and cigar smoke of [the dining - room]968-the dining - room , [Kemp]121-kemp was still pacing up and down , trying to grasp the incredible .

[He]121-kemp was altogether too excited to sleep . [[His]121-kemp servants]1023-his servants , descending sleepily , discovered [him]121-kemp , and were inclined to think that over - study had worked this ill on [him]121-kemp . [He]121-kemp gave [them]1023-his servants extraordinary but quite explicit instructions to lay breakfast for two in [the belvedere study]1024-the belvedere study and then to confine [themselves]1023-his servants to [the basement]1025-the basement and ground - floor . Then [he]121-kemp continued to pace [the dining - room]968-the dining - room until the morning s paper came . That had much to say and little to tell , beyond the confirmation of the evening before , and a very badly written account of another remarkable tale from [Port Burdock]122-port burdock . This gave [Kemp]121-kemp the essence of the happenings at [the " Jolly Cricketers]27-the " jolly cricketers , "[73-mr. marvel] and the name of [Marvel]73-mr. marvel . " [He]73-mr. marvel has made [me]73-mr. marvel keep with [him]73-mr. marvel twenty - four hours , "[73-mr. marvel] [Marvel]73-mr. marvel testified . Certain minor facts were added to the Iping story , notably the cutting of the village telegraph - wire . But there was nothing to throw light on the connexion between [the Invisible Man]105-the invisible man and [the Tramp]1713-the tramp ; for [Mr. Marvel]73-mr. marvel had supplied no information about the three books , or the money with which [he]73-mr. marvel was lined . The incredulous tone had vanished and a shoal of [reporters and inquirers]1028-reporters and inquirers were already at work elaborating the matter .

[Kemp]121-kemp read every scrap of the report and sent [[his]121-kemp housemaid]1029-his housemaid out to get every one of the morning papers [she]1029-his housemaid could . These also [he]121-kemp devoured .

" [He]73-mr. marvel is invisible ! "[121-kemp] [he]121-kemp said . " And it reads like rage growing to mania ! The things [he]73-mr. marvel may do ! The things [he]73-mr. marvel may do ! And [he]73-mr. marvel s upstairs free as the air . What on earth ought [I]121-kemp to do ? "[121-kemp]

" For instance , would it be a breach of faith if ? No . "[1029-his housemaid]

[He]121-kemp went to a little untidy desk in the corner , and began a note . [He]121-kemp tore this up half written , and wrote another . [He]121-kemp read it over and considered it . Then [he]121-kemp took an envelope and addressed it to " [Colonel Adye]133-adye , [Port Burdock]122-port burdock . "[121-kemp]

[The Invisible Man]105-the invisible man awoke even as [Kemp]121-kemp was doing this . Then a chair was flung over and the wash - hand stand tumbler smashed . [Kemp]121-kemp hurried [upstairs]256-upstairs and rapped eagerly .

CHAPTER XIX . CERTAIN FIRST PRINCIPLES

" What s the matter ? "[121-kemp] asked [Kemp]121-kemp , when [the Invisible Man]105-the invisible man admitted [him]121-kemp .

" Nothing , "[105-the invisible man] was the answer .

" But , confound it ! The smash ? "[105-the invisible man]

" Fit of temper , "[105-the invisible man] said [the Invisible Man]105-the invisible man . " Forgot this arm ; and it s sore . "[105-the invisible man]

" [You]121-kemp re rather liable to that sort of thing . "[105-the invisible man]

" [I]105-the invisible man am . "[105-the invisible man]

[Kemp]121-kemp walked across [the room]1421-the room and picked up the fragments of broken glass . " All the facts are out about [you]105-the invisible man , "[121-kemp] said [Kemp]121-kemp , standing up with the glass in [his]121-kemp hand ; " all that happened in [Iping]4-iping , and down [the hill]592-the hill . [The world]547-the world has become aware of [[its]547-the world invisible citizen]1718-its invisible citizen . But [no one]248-no one knows [you]121-kemp are [here]1660-here . "[121-kemp]

[The Invisible Man]105-the invisible man swore .

" The secret s out . [I]121-kemp gather it was a secret . [I]121-kemp don t know what [your]121-kemp plans are , but of course [I]121-kemp m anxious to help [you]121-kemp . "[121-kemp]

[The Invisible Man]105-the invisible man sat down on the bed .

" There s breakfast [upstairs]256-upstairs , "[121-kemp] said [Kemp]121-kemp , speaking as easily as possible , and [he]121-kemp was delighted to find [[his]121-kemp strange guest]1033-his strange guest rose willingly . [Kemp]121-kemp led the way up the narrow staircase to [the belvedere]1034-the belvedere .

" Before [we]1722-we can do anything else , "[121-kemp] said [Kemp]121-kemp , " [I]121-kemp must understand a little more about this invisibility of [yours]121-kemp . "[121-kemp] [He]121-kemp had sat down , after one nervous glance out of the window , with the air of [a man who has talking to do]1035-a man who has talking to do . [His]121-kemp doubts of the sanity of the entire business flashed and vanished again as [he]121-kemp looked across to where [Griffin]131-griffin sat at the breakfast - table a headless , handless dressing - gown , wiping unseen lips on a miraculously held serviette .

" It s simple enough and credible enough , "[131-griffin] said [Griffin]131-griffin , putting the serviette aside and leaning the invisible head on an invisible hand .

" No doubt , to [you]105-the invisible man , but "[121-kemp] [Kemp]121-kemp laughed .

" Well , yes ; to [me]121-kemp it seemed wonderful at first , no doubt . But now , [great God]132-great god ! ... But [we]1722-we will do great things yet ! [I]121-kemp came on the stuff first at [Chesilstowe]28-chesilstowe . "[121-kemp]

" [Chesilstowe]28-chesilstowe ? "[121-kemp]

" [I]121-kemp went [there]1426-there after [I]121-kemp left [London]20-london . [You]105-the invisible man know [I]121-kemp dropped medicine and took up physics ? No ; well , [I]121-kemp did . _ Light _ fascinated [me]121-kemp . "[121-kemp]

" Ah ! "[121-kemp]

" Optical density ! The whole subject is a network of riddles a network with solutions glimmering elusively through . And being but two - and - twenty and full of enthusiasm , [I]121-kemp said , [I]121-kemp will devote [my]121-kemp life to this . This is worth while . [You]105-the invisible man know what [fools]1724-fools [we]1722-we are at two - and - twenty ? "[121-kemp]

" [Fools]1724-fools then or [fools]1724-fools now , "[121-kemp] said [Kemp]121-kemp .

" As though knowing could be any satisfaction to [a man]1463-a man ! "[121-kemp]

" But [I]121-kemp went to work like [a slave]1728-a slave . And [I]121-kemp had hardly worked and thought about the matter six months before light came through one of the meshes suddenly blindingly ! [I]121-kemp found a general principle of pigments and refraction a formula , a geometrical expression involving four dimensions . [Fools]1724-fools , [common men]1730-common men , even [common mathematicians]1731-common mathematicians , do not know anything of what some general expression may mean to [the student of molecular physics]1732-the student of molecular physics . In the books the books that tramp has hidden there are marvels , miracles ! But this was not a method , it was an idea , that might lead to a method by which it would be possible , without changing any other property of matter except , in some instances colours to lower the refractive index of a substance , solid or liquid , to that of air so far as all practical purposes are concerned . "[121-kemp]

" Phew ! "[121-kemp] said [Kemp]121-kemp . " That s odd ! But still [I]121-kemp don t see quite ... [I]121-kemp can understand that thereby [you]105-the invisible man could spoil a valuable stone , but personal invisibility is a far cry . "[121-kemp]

" Precisely , "[131-griffin] said [Griffin]131-griffin . " But consider , visibility depends on the action of the visible bodies on light . Either a body absorbs light , or [it]1733-it reflects or refracts it , or does all these things . If it neither reflects nor refracts nor absorbs light , it can not of itself be visible . [You]105-the invisible man see an opaque red box , for instance , because the colour absorbs some of the light and reflects the rest , all the red part of the light , to [you]105-the invisible man . If it did not absorb any particular part of the light , but reflected it all , then it would be a shining white box . Silver ! A diamond box would neither absorb much of the light nor reflect much from the general surface , but just here and there where the surfaces were favourable the light would be reflected and refracted , so that [you]105-the invisible man would get a brilliant appearance of flashing reflections and translucencies a sort of skeleton of light . A glass box would not be so brilliant , nor so clearly visible , as a diamond box , because there would be less refraction and reflection . See that ? From certain points of view [you]105-the invisible man would see quite clearly through it . Some kinds of glass would be more visible than others , a box of flint glass would be brighter than a box of ordinary window glass . A box of very thin common glass would be hard to see in a bad light , because it would absorb hardly any light and refract and reflect very little . And if [you]105-the invisible man put a sheet of common white glass in water , still more if [you]105-the invisible man put [it]1734-it in some denser liquid than water , it would vanish almost altogether , because light passing from water to glass is only slightly refracted or reflected or indeed affected in any way . It is almost as invisible as a jet of coal gas or hydrogen is in air . And for precisely the same reason ! "[131-griffin]

" Yes , "[121-kemp] said [Kemp]121-kemp , " that is pretty plain sailing . "[121-kemp]

" And here is another fact [you]105-the invisible man will know to be true . If a sheet of glass is smashed , [Kemp]121-kemp , and beaten into a powder , it becomes much more visible while it is in the air ; it becomes at last an opaque white powder . This is because the powdering multiplies the surfaces of the glass at which refraction and reflection occur . In the sheet of glass there are only two surfaces ; in the powder the light is reflected or refracted by each grain it passes through , and very little gets right through the powder . But if the white powdered glass is put into water , it forthwith vanishes . The powdered glass and water have much the same refractive index ; that is , the light undergoes very little refraction or reflection in passing from one to the other . "[121-kemp]

" [You]105-the invisible man make the glass invisible by putting it into a liquid of nearly the same refractive index ; a transparent thing becomes invisible if it is put in any medium of almost the same refractive index . And if [you]105-the invisible man will consider only a second , [you]105-the invisible man will see also that the powder of glass might be made to vanish in air , if its refractive index could be made the same as that of air ; for then there would be no refraction or reflection as the light passed from glass to air . "[121-kemp]

" Yes , yes , "[121-kemp] said [Kemp]121-kemp . " But [a man s not powdered glass]1735-a man s not powdered glass ! "[121-kemp]

" No , "[131-griffin] said [Griffin]131-griffin . " [He]1735-a man s not powdered glass s more transparent ! "[131-griffin]

" Nonsense ! "[121-kemp]

" That from [a doctor]1736-a doctor ! How [one]214-one forgets ! Have [you]105-the invisible man already forgotten [your]105-the invisible man physics , in ten years ? Just think of all the things that are transparent and seem not to be so . Paper , for instance , is made up of transparent fibres , and it is white and opaque only for the same reason that a powder of glass is white and opaque . Oil white paper , fill up the interstices between the particles with oil so that there is no longer refraction or reflection except at the surfaces , and it becomes as transparent as glass . And not only paper , but cotton fibre , linen fibre , wool fibre , woody fibre , and _ bone _ , [Kemp]121-kemp , _ flesh _ , [Kemp]121-kemp , _ hair _ , [Kemp]121-kemp , _ nails _ and _ nerves _ , [Kemp]121-kemp , in fact the whole fabric of [a man]1463-a man except the red of [his]1463-a man blood and the black pigment of hair , are all made up of transparent , colourless tissue . So little suffices to make [us]1739-us visible one to the other . For the most part the fibres of [a living creature]1740-a living creature are no more opaque than water . "[131-griffin]

" Great Heavens ! "[121-kemp] cried [Kemp]121-kemp . " Of course , of course ! [I]121-kemp was thinking only last night of the sea larvae and all jelly - fish ! "[121-kemp]

" _ Now _ [you]105-the invisible man have [me]131-griffin ! And all that [I]131-griffin knew and had in mind a year after [I]131-griffin left [London]20-london six years ago . But [I]131-griffin kept it to [myself]131-griffin . [I]131-griffin had to do [my]131-griffin work under frightful disadvantages . [Oliver]134-oliver , [[my]131-griffin professor]1741-my professor , was [a scientific bounder]1742-a scientific bounder , [a journalist by instinct]1743-a journalist by instinct , a thief of ideas [he]1741-my professor was always prying ! And [you]105-the invisible man know the knavish system of [the scientific world]1744-the scientific world . [I]131-griffin simply would not publish , and let [him]134-oliver share [my]131-griffin credit . [I]131-griffin went on working ; [I]131-griffin got nearer and nearer making [my]131-griffin formula into an experiment , a reality . [I]131-griffin told [no living soul]1745-no living soul , because [I]131-griffin meant to flash [my]131-griffin work upon [the world]547-the world with crushing effect and become famous at a blow . [I]131-griffin took up the question of pigments to fill up certain gaps . And suddenly , not by design but by accident , [I]131-griffin made a discovery in physiology . "[131-griffin]

" Yes ? "[121-kemp]

" [You]121-kemp know the red colouring matter of blood ; it can be made white colourless and remain with all the functions it has now ! "[131-griffin]

[Kemp]121-kemp gave a cry of incredulous amazement .

[The Invisible Man]105-the invisible man rose and began pacing [the little study]1036-the little study . " [You]121-kemp may well exclaim . [I]105-the invisible man remember that night . It was late at night in the daytime one was bothered with [the gaping , silly students]1747-the gaping , silly students and [I]105-the invisible man worked then sometimes till dawn . It came suddenly , splendid and complete in [my]105-the invisible man mind . [I]105-the invisible man was alone ; [the laboratory]1748-the laboratory was still , with the tall lights burning brightly and silently . In all [my]105-the invisible man great moments [I]105-the invisible man have been alone . [One]214-one could make an animal a tissue transparent ! One could make it invisible ! All except the pigments [I]105-the invisible man could be invisible ! [I]105-the invisible man said , suddenly realising what it meant to be [an albino with such knowledge]1750-an albino with such knowledge . It was overwhelming . [I]105-the invisible man left the filtering [I]105-the invisible man was doing , and went and stared out of the great window at the stars . [I]105-the invisible man could be invisible ! [I]105-the invisible man repeated .[105-the invisible man]

" To do such a thing would be to transcend magic . And [I]131-griffin beheld , unclouded by doubt , a magnificent vision of all that invisibility might mean to [a man]1463-a man the mystery , the power , the freedom . Drawbacks [I]131-griffin saw none . [You]121-kemp have only to think ! And [I]131-griffin , [a shabby , poverty - struck , hemmed]1752-a shabby , poverty - struck , hemmed - in demonstrator , [teaching fools in [a provincial college]1754-a provincial college]1753-teaching fools in a provincial college , might suddenly become this . [I]131-griffin ask [you]121-kemp , [Kemp]121-kemp if _ [you]121-kemp _ ... Anyone , [I]131-griffin tell [you]121-kemp , would have flung [himself]1463-a man upon that research . And [I]131-griffin worked three years , and every mountain of difficulty [I]131-griffin toiled over showed another from [its]1755-its summit . The infinite details ! And the exasperation ! [A professor]1756-a professor , [a provincial professor]1757-a provincial professor , always prying . When are [you]121-kemp going to publish this work of [yours]121-kemp ? was [his]121-kemp everlasting question . And [the students]1758-the students , the cramped means ! Three years [I]131-griffin had of it[131-griffin]

" And after three years of secrecy and exasperation , [I]105-the invisible man found that to complete it was impossible impossible . "[105-the invisible man]

" How ? "[121-kemp] asked [Kemp]121-kemp .

" Money , "[105-the invisible man] said [the Invisible Man]105-the invisible man , and went again to stare out of the window .

[He]121-kemp turned around abruptly . " [I]121-kemp robbed [the old man]1759-the old man robbed [[my]121-kemp father]1760-my father . "[121-kemp]

" The money was not [his]1759-the old man , and [he]1759-the old man shot [himself]1759-the old man . "[105-the invisible man]

CHAPTER XX . AT [THE HOUSE]29-the house IN [GREAT PORTLAND STREET]30-great portland street

For a moment [Kemp]121-kemp sat in silence , staring at the back of [the headless figure at the window]1037-the headless figure at the window . Then [he]121-kemp started , struck by a thought , rose , took [the Invisible Man]150-the invisible man s arm , and turned [him]121-kemp away from the outlook .

" [You]131-griffin are tired , "[121-kemp] [he]121-kemp said , " and while [I]121-kemp sit , [you]131-griffin walk about . Have [my]121-kemp chair . "[121-kemp]

[He]121-kemp placed [himself]121-kemp between [Griffin]131-griffin and the nearest window .

For a space [Griffin]131-griffin sat silent , and then [he]131-griffin resumed abruptly :

" [I]131-griffin had left [the Chesilstowe cottage]1761-the chesilstowe cottage already , "[131-griffin] [he]131-griffin said , " when that happened . It was last December . [I]131-griffin had taken [a room in [London]20-london]1762-a room in london , [a large unfurnished room in [a big ill - managed lodging - house]1764-a big ill - managed lodging - house in [a slum near [Great Portland Street]30-great portland street]1765-a slum near great portland street]1763-a large unfurnished room in a big ill - managed lodging - house in a slum near great portland street . [The room]1421-the room was soon full of the appliances [I]131-griffin had bought with [his]131-griffin money ; the work was going on steadily , successfully , drawing near an end . [I]131-griffin was like [a man emerging from a thicket , and suddenly coming on some unmeaning tragedy]1767-a man emerging from a thicket , and suddenly coming on some unmeaning tragedy . [I]131-griffin went to bury [him]131-griffin . [My]131-griffin mind was still on this research , and [I]131-griffin did not lift a finger to save [his]131-griffin character . [I]131-griffin remember the funeral , the cheap hearse , the scant ceremony , [the windy frost - bitten hillside]1768-the windy frost - bitten hillside , and [the old college friend of [his]131-griffin who read the service over [him]131-griffin [a shabby , black , bent old man with a snivelling cold]1770-a shabby , black , bent old man with a snivelling cold]1769-the old college friend of his who read the service over him a shabby , black , bent old man with a snivelling cold .[131-griffin]

" [I]131-griffin remember walking back to [the empty house]1771-the empty house , through [the place that had once been [a village]1773-a village and was now patched and tinkered by [the jerry builders]1774-the jerry builders into the ugly likeness of [a town]1775-a town]1772-the place that had once been a village and was now patched and tinkered by the jerry builders into the ugly likeness of a town . Every way [the roads]1776-the roads ran out at last into [the desecrated fields]1777-the desecrated fields and ended in rubble heaps and rank wet weeds . [I]131-griffin remember [myself]131-griffin as [a gaunt black figure]1778-a gaunt black figure , going along the slippery , shiny pavement , and the strange sense of detachment [I]131-griffin felt from the squalid respectability , the sordid commercialism of [the place]351-the place .[131-griffin]

" [I]131-griffin did not feel a bit sorry for [[my]131-griffin father]1760-my father . [He]1760-my father seemed to [me]131-griffin to be the victim of [his]1760-my father own foolish sentimentality . The current ca nt required [my]131-griffin attendance at [his]1760-my father funeral , but it was really not [my]131-griffin affair .[131-griffin]

" But going along [the High Street]31-the high street , [my]131-griffin old life came back to [me]131-griffin for a space , for [I]131-griffin met [the girl [I]131-griffin had known]1781-the girl i had known ten years since . [Our]1782-we eyes met .[131-griffin]

" Something moved [me]131-griffin to turn back and talk to [her]1781-the girl i had known . [She]1781-the girl i had known was [a very ordinary person]1783-a very ordinary person .[131-griffin]

" It was all like a dream , that visit to [the old places]1784-the old places . [I]131-griffin did not feel then that [I]131-griffin was lonely , that [I]131-griffin had come out from [the world]547-the world into [a desolate place]1786-a desolate place . [I]131-griffin appreciated [my]131-griffin loss of sympathy , but [I]131-griffin put it down to the general inanity of things . Re - entering [[my]131-griffin room]1696-my room seemed like the recovery of reality . There were the things [I]131-griffin knew and loved . There stood the apparatus , the experiments arranged and waiting . And now there was scarcely a difficulty left , beyond the planning of details .[131-griffin]

" [I]131-griffin will tell [you]1788-you , [Kemp]121-kemp , sooner or later , all the complicated processes . [We]1782-we need not go into that now . For the most part , saving certain gaps [I]131-griffin chose to remember , they are written in cypher in those books that [tramp]1789-tramp has hidden . [We]1782-we must hunt [him]1789-tramp down . [We]1782-we must get those books again . But the essential phase was to place the transparent object whose refractive index was to be lowered between two radiating centres of a sort of ethereal vibration , of which [I]131-griffin will tell [you]1788-you more fully later . No , not those R ntgen vibrations [I]131-griffin don t know that these others of [mine]131-griffin have been described . Yet they are obvious enough . [I]131-griffin needed two little dynamos , and these [I]131-griffin worked with [a cheap gas engine]1790-a cheap gas engine . [My]131-griffin first experiment was with a bit of white wool fabric . It was the strangest thing in [the world]547-the world to see it in the flicker of the flashes soft and white , and then to watch it fade like a wreath of smoke and vanish . "[131-griffin]

" [I]131-griffin could scarcely believe [I]131-griffin had done it . [I]131-griffin put [my]131-griffin hand into the emptiness , and there was the thing as solid as ever . [I]131-griffin felt it awkwardly , and threw it on the floor . [I]131-griffin had a little trouble finding it again . "[131-griffin]

" And then came a curious experience . [I]131-griffin heard a miaow behind [me]131-griffin , and turning , saw a lean white cat , very dirty , on the cistern cover outside the window . A thought came into [my]131-griffin head . Everything ready for [you]1788-you , [I]131-griffin said , and went to the window , opened it , and called softly . [She]1792-her came in , purring the poor beast was starving and [I]131-griffin gave [her]1792-her some milk . All [my]131-griffin food was in a cupboard in the corner of [the room]1421-the room . After that [she]1792-her went smelling round [the room]1421-the room , evidently with the idea of making [herself]1792-her at [home]1466-home . The invisible rag upset [her]1792-her a bit ; [you]1788-you should have seen [her]1792-her spit at it ! But [I]131-griffin made [her]1792-her comfortable on the pillow of [[my]131-griffin truckle - bed]1796-my truckle - bed . And [I]131-griffin gave [her]1792-her butter to get [her]1792-her to wash . "[131-griffin]

" And [you]131-griffin processed [her]1792-her ? "[131-griffin]

" [I]131-griffin processed [her]1792-her . But giving drugs to a cat is no joke , [Kemp]121-kemp ! And the process failed . "[131-griffin]

" Failed ! "[131-griffin]

" In two particulars . These were the claws and the pigment stuff , what is it ? at the back of the eye in a cat . [You]131-griffin know ? "[131-griffin]

" _ Tapetum _ . "[131-griffin]

" Yes , the _ tapetum _ . It didn t go . After [I]131-griffin d given the stuff to bleach the blood and done certain other things to [her]1792-her , [I]131-griffin gave the beast opium , and put [her]1792-her and the pillow [she]1792-her was sleeping on , on the apparatus . And after all the rest had faded and vanished , there remained two little ghosts of [her]1792-her eyes . "[131-griffin]

" Odd ! "[131-griffin]

" [I]131-griffin can t explain it . [She]1792-her was bandaged and clamped , of course so [I]131-griffin had [her]1792-her safe ; but [she]1792-her woke while [she]1792-her was still misty , and miaowed dismally , and [someone]428-someone came knocking . It was [an old woman from [downstairs]377-downstairs , who suspected [me]131-griffin of vivisecting a drink - sodden old creature , with only a white cat to care for in all [the world]547-the world]1798-an old woman from downstairs , who suspected me of vivisecting a drink - sodden old creature , with only a white cat to care for in all the world . [I]131-griffin whipped out some chloroform , applied it , and answered the door . Did [I]131-griffin hear a cat ? [she]1798-an old woman from downstairs , who suspected me of vivisecting a drink - sodden old creature , with only a white cat to care for in all the world asked . [My]131-griffin cat ? Not here , said [I]131-griffin , very politely . [She]1792-her was a little doubtful and tried to peer past [me]131-griffin into [the room]1421-the room ; strange enough to [her]1792-her no doubt bare walls , uncurtained windows , [truckle - bed]1802-truckle - bed , with the gas engine vibrating , and the seethe of the radiant points , and that faint ghastly stinging of chloroform in the air . [She]1792-her had to be satisfied at last and went away again . "[131-griffin]

" How long did it take ? "[121-kemp] asked [Kemp]121-kemp .

" Three or four hours the cat . The bones and sinews and the fat were the last to go , and the tips of the coloured hairs . And , as [I]131-griffin say , the back part of the eye , tough , iridescent stuff it is , wouldn t go at all . "[131-griffin]

" It was night outside long before the business was over , and nothing was to be seen but the dim eyes and the claws . [I]131-griffin stopped the gas engine , felt for and stroked the beast , which was still insensible , and then , being tired , left [it]1792-her sleeping on the invisible pillow and went to bed . [I]131-griffin found it hard to sleep . [I]131-griffin lay awake thinking weak aimless stuff , going over the experiment over and over again , or dreaming feverishly of things growing misty and vanishing about [me]131-griffin , until everything , the ground [I]131-griffin stood on , vanished , and so [I]131-griffin came to that sickly falling nightmare one gets . About two , the cat began miaowing about [the room]1421-the room . [I]131-griffin tried to hush it by talking to it , and then [I]131-griffin decided to turn it out . [I]131-griffin remember the shock [I]131-griffin had when striking a light there were just the round eyes shining green and nothing round them . [I]131-griffin would have given it milk , but [I]131-griffin hadn t any . It wouldn t be quiet , it just sat down and miaowed at the door . [I]131-griffin tried to catch it , with an idea of putting it out of the window , but it wouldn t be caught , it vanished . Then [it]1792-her began miaowing in different parts of [the room]1421-the room . At last [I]131-griffin opened the window and made a bustle . [I]131-griffin suppose it went out at last . [I]131-griffin never saw any more of it . "[131-griffin]

" Then Heaven knows why [I]131-griffin fell thinking of [[my]131-griffin father]1760-my father s funeral again , and [the dismal windy hillside]1806-the dismal windy hillside , until the day had come . [I]131-griffin found sleeping was hopeless , and , locking [my]131-griffin door after [me]131-griffin , wandered out into [the morning streets]1807-the morning streets . "[131-griffin]

" [You]105-the invisible man don t mean to say there s an invisible cat at large ! "[121-kemp] said [Kemp]121-kemp .

" If it hasn t been killed , "[105-the invisible man] said [the Invisible Man]105-the invisible man . " Why not ? "[105-the invisible man]

" Why not ? "[121-kemp] said [Kemp]121-kemp . " [I]121-kemp didn t mean to interrupt . "[121-kemp]

" [It]1808-it s very probably been killed , "[150-the invisible man] said [the Invisible Man]150-the invisible man . " [It]1808-it was alive four days after , [I]150-the invisible man know , and down [a grating in [Great Titchfield Street]32-great titchfield street]1809-a grating in great titchfield street ; because [I]150-the invisible man saw [a crowd]1810-a crowd round [the place]351-the place , trying to see whence the miaowing came . "[150-the invisible man]

[He]121-kemp was silent for the best part of a minute . Then [he]121-kemp resumed abruptly :

" [I]121-kemp remember that morning before the change very vividly . [I]121-kemp must have gone up [Great Portland Street]30-great portland street . [I]121-kemp remember [the barracks]1812-the barracks in [Albany Street]33-albany street , and [the horse soldiers]1813-the horse soldiers coming out , and at last [I]121-kemp found [the summit of [Primrose Hill]34-primrose hill]1814-the summit of primrose hill . It was a sunny day in January one of those sunny , frosty days that came before the snow this year . [My]121-kemp weary brain tried to formulate the position , to plot out a plan of action . "[121-kemp]

" [I]121-kemp was surprised to find , now that [my]121-kemp prize was within [my]121-kemp grasp , how inconclusive its attainment seemed . As a matter of fact [I]121-kemp was worked out ; the intense stress of nearly four years continuous work left [me]121-kemp incapable of any strength of feeling . [I]121-kemp was apathetic , and [I]121-kemp tried in vain to recover the enthusiasm of [my]121-kemp first inquiries , the passion of discovery that had enabled [me]121-kemp to compass even the downfall of [[my]121-kemp father]1760-my father s grey hairs . Nothing seemed to matter . [I]121-kemp saw pretty clearly this was a transient mood , due to overwork and want of sleep , and that either by drugs or rest it would be possible to recover [my]121-kemp energies . "[121-kemp]

" All [I]121-kemp could think clearly was that the thing had to be carried through ; the fixed idea still ruled [me]121-kemp . And soon , for the money [I]121-kemp had was almost exhausted . [I]121-kemp looked about [me]121-kemp at [the hillside]1816-the hillside , with [children]265-children playing and [girls]521-girls watching [them]1816-the hillside , and tried to think of all the fantastic advantages [an invisible man]1549-an invisible man would have in [the world]547-the world . After a time [I]121-kemp crawled [home]1466-home , took some food and a strong dose of strychnine , and went to sleep in [my]121-kemp clothes on [my]121-kemp unmade bed . Strychnine is a grand tonic , [Kemp]121-kemp , to take the flabbiness out of [a man]1463-a man . "[121-kemp]

" It s the devil , "[121-kemp] said [Kemp]121-kemp . " It s the palaeolithic in a bottle . "[121-kemp]

" [I]121-kemp awoke vastly invigorated and rather irritable . [You]121-kemp know ? "[121-kemp]

" [I]121-kemp know the stuff . "[121-kemp]

" And there was [someone rapping at the door]1823-someone rapping at the door . [It]1823-someone rapping at the door was [[my]121-kemp landlord]1824-my landlord with threats and inquiries , [an old Polish Jew in a long grey coat and greasy slippers]1825-an old polish jew in a long grey coat and greasy slippers . [I]121-kemp had been tormenting a cat in the night , [he]1824-my landlord was sure [the old woman]1826-the old woman s tongue had been busy . [He]1824-my landlord insisted on knowing all about it . The laws in [this country]1541-this country against vivisection were very severe [he]1824-my landlord might be liable . [I]121-kemp denied the cat . Then the vibration of the little gas engine could be felt all over [the house]396-the house , [he]1824-my landlord said . That was true , certainly . [He]1824-my landlord edged round [me]121-kemp into [the room]1421-the room , peering about over [his]1824-my landlord German - silver spectacles , and a sudden dread came into [my]121-kemp mind that [he]1824-my landlord might carry away something of [my]121-kemp secret . [I]121-kemp tried to keep between [him]1824-my landlord and the concentrating apparatus [I]121-kemp had arranged , and that only made [him]1824-my landlord more curious . What was [I]121-kemp doing ? Why was [I]121-kemp always alone and secretive ? Was it legal ? Was it dangerous ? [I]121-kemp paid nothing but the usual rent . [His]1824-my landlord had always been [a most respectable house in [a disreputable neighbourhood]1831-a disreputable neighbourhood]1830-a most respectable house in a disreputable neighbourhood . Suddenly [my]121-kemp temper gave way . [I]121-kemp told [him]1824-my landlord to get out . [He]1824-my landlord began to protest , to jabber of [his]1824-my landlord right of entry . In a moment [I]121-kemp had [him]1824-my landlord by the collar ; something ripped , and [he]1824-my landlord went spinning out into [his]1824-my landlord own passage . [I]121-kemp slammed and locked the door and sat down quivering .[121-kemp]

" [He]1824-my landlord made a fuss outside , which [I]121-kemp disregarded , and after a time [he]1824-my landlord went away .[121-kemp]

" But this brought matters to a crisis . [I]121-kemp did not know what [he]1824-my landlord would do , nor even what [he]1824-my landlord had the power to do . To move to [fresh apartments]1832-fresh apartments would have meant delay ; altogether [I]121-kemp had barely twenty pounds left in [the world]547-the world , for the most part in [a bank]1834-a bank and [I]121-kemp could not afford that . Vanish ! It was irresistible . Then there would be an inquiry , the sacking of [[my]121-kemp room]1696-my room .[121-kemp]

" At the thought of the possibility of [my]121-kemp work being exposed or interrupted at its very climax , [I]121-kemp became very angry and active . [I]121-kemp hurried out with [my]121-kemp three books of notes , [my]121-kemp cheque - book [the tramp]1713-the tramp has them now and directed them from [the nearest Post Office]1837-the nearest post office to [a house of call]1838-a house of call for letters and parcels in [Great Portland Street]30-great portland street . [I]121-kemp tried to go out noiselessly . Coming in , [I]121-kemp found [[my]121-kemp landlord]1824-my landlord going quietly [upstairs]256-upstairs ; [he]1824-my landlord had heard the door close , [I]121-kemp suppose . [You]1841-you would have laughed to see [him]1824-my landlord jump aside on [the landing]368-the landing as [I]121-kemp came tearing after [him]1824-my landlord . [He]1824-my landlord glared at [me]121-kemp as [I]121-kemp went by [him]1824-my landlord , and [I]121-kemp made [the house]396-the house quiver with the slamming of [my]121-kemp door . [I]121-kemp heard [him]1824-my landlord come shuffling up to [my]121-kemp floor , hesitate , and go down . [I]121-kemp set to work upon [my]121-kemp preparations forthwith .[121-kemp]

" It was all done that evening and night . While [I]121-kemp was still sitting under the sickly , drowsy influence of the drugs that decolourise blood , there came a repeated knocking at the door . It ceased , footsteps went away and returned , and the knocking was resumed . There was an attempt to push something under the door a blue paper . Then in a fit of irritation [I]121-kemp rose and went and flung the door wide open . Now then ? said [I.]121-kemp[121-kemp]

" It was [[my]121-kemp landlord]1824-my landlord , with a notice of ejectment or something . [He]1824-my landlord held it out to [me]121-kemp , saw something odd about [my]121-kemp hands , [I]121-kemp expect , and lifted [his]1824-my landlord eyes to [my]121-kemp face .[121-kemp]

" For a moment [he]1824-my landlord gaped . Then [he]1824-my landlord gave a sort of inarticulate cry , dropped candle and writ together , and went blundering down [the dark passage]1845-the dark passage to the stairs . [I]121-kemp shut the door , locked it , and went to the looking - glass . Then [I]121-kemp understood [his]1824-my landlord terror .... [My]121-kemp face was white like white stone .[121-kemp]

" But it was all horrible . [I]121-kemp had not expected the suffering . A night of racking anguish , sickness and fainting . [I]121-kemp set [my]121-kemp teeth , though [my]121-kemp skin was presently afire , all [my]121-kemp body afire ; but [I]121-kemp lay there like grim death . [I]121-kemp understood now how it was the cat had howled until [I]121-kemp chloroformed it . Lucky it was [I]121-kemp lived alone and untended in [[my]121-kemp room]1696-my room . There were times when [I]121-kemp sobbed and groaned and talked . But [I]121-kemp stuck to it .... [I]121-kemp became insensible and woke languid in the darkness .[121-kemp]

" The pain had passed . [I]121-kemp thought [I]121-kemp was killing [myself]121-kemp and [I]121-kemp did not care . [I]121-kemp shall never forget that dawn , and the strange horror of seeing that [my]121-kemp hands had become as clouded glass , and watching them grow clearer and thinner as the day went by , until at last [I]121-kemp could see the sickly disorder of [[my]121-kemp room]1696-my room through them , though [I]121-kemp closed [my]121-kemp transparent eyelids . [My]121-kemp limbs became glassy , the bones and arteries faded , vanished , and the little white nerves went last . [I]121-kemp gritted [my]121-kemp teeth and stayed there to the end . At last only the dead tips of the fingernails remained , pallid and white , and the brown stain of some acid upon [my]121-kemp fingers .[121-kemp]

" [I]121-kemp struggled up . At first [I]121-kemp was as incapable as a swathed infant stepping with limbs [I]121-kemp could not see . [I]121-kemp was weak and very hungry . [I]121-kemp went and stared at nothing in [my]121-kemp shaving - glass , at nothing save where an attenuated pigment still remained behind the retina of [my]121-kemp eyes , fainter than mist . [I]121-kemp had to hang on to the table and press [my]121-kemp forehead against the glass .[121-kemp]

" It was only by a frantic effort of will that [I]121-kemp dragged [myself]121-kemp back to the apparatus and completed the process .[121-kemp]

" [I]121-kemp slept during the forenoon , pulling the sheet over [my]121-kemp eyes to shut out the light , and about midday [I]121-kemp was awakened again by a knocking . [My]121-kemp strength had returned . [I]121-kemp sat up and listened and heard a whispering . [I]121-kemp sprang to [my]121-kemp feet and as noiselessly as possible began to detach the connections of [my]121-kemp apparatus , and to distribute it about [the room]1421-the room , so as to destroy the suggestions of [its]1421-the room arrangement . Presently the knocking was renewed and voices called , first [[my]121-kemp landlord]1824-my landlord s , and then [two others]1850-two others . To gain time [I]121-kemp answered [them]1850-two others . The invisible rag and pillow came to hand and [I]121-kemp opened the window and pitched them out on to the cistern cover . As the window opened , a heavy crash came at the door . [Someone]428-someone had charged it with the idea of smashing the lock . But the stout bolts [I]121-kemp had screwed up some days before stopped [him]428-someone . That startled [me]121-kemp , made [me]121-kemp angry . [I]121-kemp began to tremble and do things hurriedly .[121-kemp]

" [I]121-kemp tossed together some loose paper , straw , packing paper and so forth , in the middle of [the room]1421-the room , and turned on the gas . Heavy blows began to rain upon the door . [I]121-kemp could not find the matches . [I]121-kemp beat [my]121-kemp hands on the wall with rage . [I]121-kemp turned down the gas again , stepped out of the window on the cistern cover , very softly lowered the sash , and sat down , secure and invisible , but quivering with anger , to watch events . [They]1850-two others split a panel , [I]121-kemp saw , and in another moment [they]1850-two others had broken away the staples of the bolts and stood in the open doorway . It was [the landlord]1853-the landlord and [[his]1853-the landlord two step - sons]1854-his two step - sons , [sturdy young men of three or four and twenty]1855-sturdy young men of three or four and twenty . Behind [them]1850-two others fluttered the old hag of [a woman from [downstairs]377-downstairs]1856-a woman from downstairs .[121-kemp]

" [You]1858-you may imagine [their]1850-two others astonishment to find [the room]1421-the room empty . [One of [the younger men]1861-the younger men]1860-one of the younger men rushed to the window at once , flung it up and stared out . [His]1860-one of the younger men staring eyes and thick - lipped bearded face came a foot from [my]121-kemp face . [I]121-kemp was half minded to hit [his]1860-one of the younger men silly countenance , but [I]121-kemp arrested [my]121-kemp doubled fist . [He]1860-one of the younger men stared right through [me]121-kemp . So did [the others]566-the others as [they]566-the others joined [him]1860-one of the younger men . [The old man]1759-the old man went and peered under the bed , and then [they]1850-two others all made a rush for the cupboard . [They]1850-two others had to argue about it at length in Yiddish and Cockney English . [They]1850-two others concluded [I]121-kemp had not answered [them]1850-two others , that [their]1850-two others imagination had deceived [them]1850-two others . A feeling of extraordinary elation took the place of [my]121-kemp anger as [I]121-kemp sat outside the window and watched [these four people]1864-these four people for [the old lady]1865-the old lady came in , glancing suspiciously about [her]1865-the old lady like a cat , trying to understand the riddle of [my]121-kemp behaviour .[121-kemp]

" [The old man]1759-the old man , so far as [I]121-kemp could understand [his]1759-the old man _ patois _ , agreed with [the old lady]1865-the old lady that [I]121-kemp was [a vivisectionist]1868-a vivisectionist . [The sons]1869-the sons protested in garbled English that [I]121-kemp was [an electrician]1870-an electrician , and appealed to the dynamos and radiators . [They]1850-two others were all nervous about [my]121-kemp arrival , although [I]121-kemp found subsequently that [they]1850-two others had bolted the front door . [The old lady]1865-the old lady peered into the cupboard and under the bed , and [one of [the young men]1873-the young men]1872-one of the young men pushed up the register and stared up the chimney . [One of [[my]121-kemp fellow lodgers]1875-my fellow lodgers]1874-one of my fellow lodgers , [a coster - monger who shared [the opposite room]1877-the opposite room with [a butcher]1878-a butcher]1876-a coster - monger who shared the opposite room with a butcher , appeared on the landing , and [he]1874-one of my fellow lodgers was called in and told incoherent things .[121-kemp]

" It occurred to [me]121-kemp that the radiators , if [they]1850-two others fell into the hands of [some acute well - educated person]1879-some acute well - educated person , would give [me]121-kemp away too much , and watching [my]121-kemp opportunity , [I]121-kemp came into [the room]1421-the room and tilted one of the little dynamos off its fellow on which it was standing , and smashed both apparatus . Then , while [they]1850-two others were trying to explain the smash , [I]121-kemp dodged out of [the room]1421-the room and went softly [downstairs]377-downstairs .[121-kemp]

" [I]121-kemp went into [one of [the sitting - rooms]1884-the sitting - rooms]1883-one of the sitting - rooms and waited until [they]1850-two others came down , still speculating and argumentative , all a little disappointed at finding no horrors , and all a little puzzled how [they]1850-two others stood legally towards [me]121-kemp . Then [I]121-kemp slipped up again with a box of matches , fired [my]121-kemp heap of paper and rubbish , put the chairs and bedding thereby , led the gas to [the affair]1885-the affair , by means of an india - rubber tube , and waving a farewell to [the room]1421-the room left [it]1421-the room for the last time . "[121-kemp]

" [You]121-kemp fired [the house]396-the house ! "[121-kemp] exclaimed [Kemp]121-kemp .

" Fired [the house]396-the house . It was the only way to cover [my]121-kemp trail and no doubt it was insured . [I]121-kemp slipped the bolts of the front door quietly and went out into [the street]439-the street . [I]121-kemp was invisible , and [I]121-kemp was only just beginning to realise the extraordinary advantage [my]121-kemp invisibility gave [me]121-kemp . [My]121-kemp head was already teeming with plans of all the wild and wonderful things [I]121-kemp had now impunity to do . "[121-kemp]

CHAPTER XXI . IN [OXFORD STREET]35-oxford street

" In going [downstairs]377-downstairs the first time [I]121-kemp found an unexpected difficulty because [I]121-kemp could not see [my]121-kemp feet ; indeed [I]121-kemp stumbled twice , and there was an unaccustomed clumsiness in gripping the bolt . By not looking down , however , [I]121-kemp managed to walk on the level passably well .[121-kemp]

" [My]121-kemp mood , [I]121-kemp say , was one of exaltation . [I]121-kemp felt as [a seeing man]1891-a seeing man might do , with padded feet and noiseless clothes , in [a city of the blind]1892-a city of the blind . [I]121-kemp experienced a wild impulse to jest , to startle [people]330-people , to clap [men on the back]1894-men on the back , fling [people]330-people s hats astray , and generally revel in [my]121-kemp extraordinary advantage .[121-kemp]

" But hardly had [I]121-kemp emerged upon [Great Portland Street]30-great portland street , however ( [[my]121-kemp lodging]1896-my lodging was close to [the big draper s shop there]1897-the big draper s shop there ) , when [I]121-kemp heard a clashing concussion and was hit violently behind , and turning saw [a man carrying a basket of soda - water syphons]1898-a man carrying a basket of soda - water syphons , and looking in amazement at [his]1898-a man carrying a basket of soda - water syphons burden . Although the blow had really hurt [me]121-kemp , [I]121-kemp found something so irresistible in [his]1898-a man carrying a basket of soda - water syphons astonishment that [I]121-kemp laughed aloud . The devil s in the basket , [I]121-kemp said , and suddenly twisted it out of [his]1898-a man carrying a basket of soda - water syphons hand . [He]1898-a man carrying a basket of soda - water syphons let go incontinently , and [I]121-kemp swung the whole weight into the air .[121-kemp]

" But [a fool of a cabman]1899-a fool of a cabman , standing outside [a public house]1900-a public house , made a sudden rush for this , and [his]1898-a man carrying a basket of soda - water syphons extending fingers took [me]121-kemp with excruciating violence under the ear . [I]121-kemp let the whole down with a smash on [the cabman]930-the cabman , and then , with shouts and the clatter of feet about [me]121-kemp , [people]330-people coming out of [shops]827-shops , [vehicles pulling up]1904-vehicles pulling up , [I]121-kemp realised what [I]121-kemp had done for [myself]121-kemp , and cursing [my]121-kemp folly , backed against [a shop]1905-a shop window and prepared to dodge out of the confusion . In a moment [I]121-kemp should be wedged into [a crowd]1810-a crowd and inevitably discovered . [I]121-kemp pushed by [a butcher boy]1907-a butcher boy , who luckily did not turn to see the nothingness that shoved [him]1907-a butcher boy aside , and dodged behind [the cab - man]1908-the cab - man [s four - wheeler]1909-s four - wheeler . [I]121-kemp do not know how [they]1910-they settled the business . [I]121-kemp hurried straight across [the road]262-the road , which was happily clear , and hardly heeding which way [I]121-kemp went , in the fright of detection the incident had given [me]121-kemp , plunged into the afternoon throng of [Oxford Street]35-oxford street .[121-kemp]

" [I]121-kemp tried to get into the stream of [people]330-people , but [they]1910-they were too thick for [me]121-kemp , and in a moment [my]121-kemp heels were being trodden upon . [I]121-kemp took to the gutter , the roughness of which [I]121-kemp found painful to [my]121-kemp feet , and forthwith the shaft of a crawling hansom dug [me]121-kemp forcibly under the shoulder blade , reminding [me]121-kemp that [I]121-kemp was already bruised severely . [I]121-kemp staggered out of the way of [the cab]1913-the cab , avoided a perambulator by a convulsive movement , and found [myself]121-kemp behind the hansom . A happy thought saved [me]121-kemp , and as this drove slowly along [I]121-kemp followed in its immediate wake , trembling and astonished at the turn of [my]121-kemp adventure . And not only trembling , but shivering . It was a bright day in January and [I]121-kemp was stark naked and the thin slime of mud that covered [the road]262-the road was freezing . Foolish as it seems to [me]121-kemp now , [I]121-kemp had not reckoned that , transparent or not , [I]121-kemp was still amenable to the weather and all its consequences .[121-kemp]

" Then suddenly a bright idea came into [my]121-kemp head . [I]121-kemp ran round and got into [the cab]1913-the cab . And so , shivering , scared , and sniffing with the first intimations of a cold , and with the bruises in the small of [my]121-kemp back growing upon [my]121-kemp attention , [I]121-kemp drove slowly along [Oxford Street]35-oxford street and past [Tottenham Court Road]36-tottenham court road . [My]121-kemp mood was as different from that in which [I]121-kemp had sallied forth ten minutes ago as it is possible to imagine . This invisibility indeed ! The one thought that possessed [me]121-kemp was how was [I]121-kemp to get out of [the scrape [I]121-kemp was in]1916-the scrape i was in .[121-kemp]

" [We]1917-we crawled past [Mudie s]37-mudie s , and there [a tall woman with five or six yellow - labelled books]1918-a tall woman with five or six yellow - labelled books hailed [[my]121-kemp cab]1919-my cab , and [I]121-kemp sprang out just in time to escape [her]1918-a tall woman with five or six yellow - labelled books , shaving [a railway van]1920-a railway van narrowly in [my]121-kemp flight . [I]121-kemp made off up [the roadway]1921-the roadway to [Bloomsbury Square]38-bloomsbury square , intending to strike north past [the Museum]1922-the museum and so get into [the quiet district]1923-the quiet district . [I]121-kemp was now cruelly chilled , and the strangeness of [my]121-kemp situation so unnerved [me]121-kemp that [I]121-kemp whimpered as [I]121-kemp ran . At the northward corner of [the Square]1924-the square a little white dog ran out of [the Pharmaceutical Society s offices]1925-the pharmaceutical society s offices , and incontinently made for [me]121-kemp , nose down .[121-kemp]

" [I]121-kemp had never realised it before , but the nose is to the mind of a dog what the eye is to the mind of [a seeing man]1891-a seeing man . [Dogs]135-dogs perceive the scent of [a man]1463-a man moving as [men]572-men perceive [his]1463-a man vision . [This brute]1929-this brute began barking and leaping , showing , as it seemed to [me]121-kemp , only too plainly that [he]1929-this brute was aware of [me]121-kemp . [I]121-kemp crossed [Great Russell Street]39-great russell street , glancing over [my]121-kemp shoulder as [I]121-kemp did so , and went some way along [Montague Street]40-montague street before [I]121-kemp realised what [I]121-kemp was running towards .[121-kemp]

" Then [I]121-kemp became aware of a blare of music , and looking along [the street]439-the street saw [a number of people advancing out of [Russell Square]41-russell square]1931-a number of people advancing out of russell square , red shirts , and the banner of [the Salvation Army]1932-the salvation army to the fore . Such [a crowd]1810-a crowd , chanting in [the roadway]1921-the roadway and scoffing on the pavement , [I]121-kemp could not hope to penetrate , and dreading to go back and farther from [home]1466-home again , and deciding on the spur of the moment , [I]121-kemp ran up the white steps of [a house facing the museum railings]1936-a house facing the museum railings , and stood there until [the crowd]529-the crowd should have passed . [Happily]1938-happily the dog stopped at the noise of [the band]1939-the band too , hesitated , and turned tail , running back to [Bloomsbury Square]38-bloomsbury square again .[121-kemp]

" On came [the band]1939-the band , bawling with unconscious irony some hymn about When shall [we]1941-we see [His]1942-his face ? and it seemed an interminable time to [me]121-kemp before the tide of [the crowd]529-the crowd washed along [the pavement]866-the pavement by [me]121-kemp . Thud , thud , thud , came the drum with a vibrating resonance , and for the moment [I]121-kemp did not notice [two urchins]1945-two urchins stopping at the railings by [me]121-kemp . See em , said one . See what ? said [the other]424-the other . Why them footmarks bare . Like what [you]1947-you makes in mud .[121-kemp]

" [I]121-kemp looked down and saw [the youngsters]1948-the youngsters had stopped and were gaping at the muddy footmarks [I]121-kemp had left behind [me]121-kemp up the newly whitened steps . [The passing people]1949-the passing people elbowed and jostled [them]1948-the youngsters , but [their]1948-the youngsters confounded intelligence was arrested . Thud , thud , thud , when , thud , shall [we]1941-we see , thud , [his]1942-his face , thud , thud . There s [a barefoot man]1950-a barefoot man gone up [them]1951-them steps , or [I]121-kemp don t know nothing , said one . And [he]1950-a barefoot man ain t never come down again . And [his]1950-a barefoot man foot was a - bleeding .[121-kemp]

" [The thick of the crowd]1952-the thick of the crowd had already passed . Looky there , [Ted]74-henfrey , quoth [the younger of [the detectives]1954-the detectives]1953-the younger of the detectives , with the sharpness of surprise in [his]1953-the younger of the detectives voice , and pointed straight to [my]121-kemp feet . [I]121-kemp looked down and saw at once the dim suggestion of [their]1951-them outline sketched in splashes of mud . For a moment [I]121-kemp was paralysed .[121-kemp]

" Why , that s rum , said [the elder]1955-the elder . Dashed rum ! It s just like the ghost of a foot , ain t it ? [He]1950-a barefoot man hesitated and advanced with outstretched hand . [A man]1463-a man pulled up short to see what [he]1950-a barefoot man was catching , and then [a girl]1957-a girl . In another moment [he]1950-a barefoot man would have touched [me]121-kemp . Then [I]121-kemp saw what to do . [I]121-kemp made a step , [the boy]1958-the boy started back with an exclamation , and with a rapid movement [I]121-kemp swung [myself]121-kemp over into [the portico of [the next house]1960-the next house]1959-the portico of the next house . But [the smaller boy]1961-the smaller boy was sharp - eyed enough to follow the movement , and before [I]121-kemp was well down the steps and upon [the pavement]866-the pavement , [he]1961-the smaller boy had recovered from [his]1961-the smaller boy momentary astonishment and was shouting out that the feet had gone over the wall .[121-kemp]

" [They]1963-they rushed round and saw [my]121-kemp new footmarks flash into being on the lower step and upon the pavement . What s up ? asked [someone]428-someone . [Feet]136-feet ! Look ! Feet running ![121-kemp]

" [Everybody in [the road]262-the road]1965-everybody in the road , except [[my]121-kemp three pursuers]1967-my three pursuers , was pouring along after [the Salvation Army]1932-the salvation army , and this blow not only impeded [me]121-kemp but [them]1963-they . There was an eddy of surprise and interrogation . At the cost of bowling over [one young fellow]1969-one young fellow [I]121-kemp got through , and in another moment [I]121-kemp was rushing headlong round [the circuit of [Russell Square]41-russell square]1970-the circuit of russell square , with [six or seven astonished people following [my]121-kemp footmarks]1971-six or seven astonished people following my footmarks . There was no time for explanation , or else [the whole host]1972-the whole host would have been after [me]121-kemp .[121-kemp]

" Twice [I]121-kemp doubled round corners , thrice [I]121-kemp crossed [the road]262-the road and came back upon [my]121-kemp tracks , and then , as [my]121-kemp feet grew hot and dry , the damp impressions began to fade . At last [I]121-kemp had a breathing space and rubbed [my]121-kemp feet clean with [my]121-kemp hands , and so got away altogether . The last [I]121-kemp saw of the chase was a little group of [a dozen people]1974-a dozen people perhaps , studying with infinite perplexity a slowly drying footprint that had resulted from a puddle in [Tavistock Square]42-tavistock square , a footprint as isolated and incomprehensible to [them]1974-a dozen people as [Crusoe]137-crusoe s solitary discovery .[121-kemp]

" This running warmed [me]121-kemp to a certain extent , and [I]121-kemp went on with a better courage through the maze of [less frequented roads]1975-less frequented roads that runs hereabouts . [My]121-kemp back had now become very stiff and sore , [my]121-kemp tonsils were painful from [the cabman]930-the cabman s fingers , and the skin of [my]121-kemp neck had been scratched by [his]930-the cabman nails ; [my]121-kemp feet hurt exceedingly and [I]121-kemp was lame from a little cut on one foot . [I]121-kemp saw in time [a blind man]1631-a blind man approaching [me]121-kemp , and fled limping , for [I]121-kemp feared [his]930-the cabman subtle intuitions . Once or twice accidental collisions occurred and [I]121-kemp left [people]330-people amazed , with unaccountable curses ringing in [their]330-people ears . Then came something silent and quiet against [my]121-kemp face , and across [the Square]1924-the square fell a thin veil of slowly falling flakes of snow . [I]121-kemp had caught a cold , and do as [I]121-kemp would [I]121-kemp could not avoid an occasional sneeze . And [every dog that came in sight , with its pointing nose and curious sniffing]1980-every dog that came in sight , with its pointing nose and curious sniffing , was a terror to [me]121-kemp .[121-kemp]

" Then came [men]572-men and [boys]303-boys running , first one and then [others]295-others , and shouting as [they]330-people ran . It was a fire . [They]330-people ran in the direction of [[my]121-kemp lodging]1896-my lodging , and looking back down [a street]1985-a street [I]121-kemp saw a mass of black smoke streaming up above the roofs and telephone wires . It was [[my]121-kemp lodging]1896-my lodging burning ; [my]121-kemp clothes , [my]121-kemp apparatus , all [my]121-kemp resources indeed , except [my]121-kemp cheque - book and the three volumes of memoranda that awaited [me]121-kemp in [Great Portland Street]30-great portland street , were there . Burning ! [I]121-kemp had burnt [[my]121-kemp boats]1987-my boats if ever [a man]1463-a man did ! [The place]351-the place was blazing . "[121-kemp]

[The Invisible Man]105-the invisible man paused and thought . [Kemp]121-kemp glanced nervously out of the window . " Yes ? "[121-kemp] [he]121-kemp said . " Go on . "[121-kemp]

CHAPTER XXII . IN [THE EMPORIUM]1040-the emporium

" So last January , with the beginning of a snowstorm in the air about [me]121-kemp and if it settled on [me]121-kemp it would betray [me]121-kemp ! weary , cold , painful , inexpressibly wretched , and still but half convinced of [my]121-kemp invisible quality , [I]121-kemp began this new life to which [I]121-kemp am committed . [I]121-kemp had no refuge , no appliances , [no human being in [the world]547-the world in whom [I]121-kemp could confide]1990-no human being in the world in whom i could confide . To have told [my]121-kemp secret would have given [me]121-kemp away made a mere show and rarity of [me]121-kemp . Nevertheless , [I]121-kemp was half - minded to accost [some passer - by]1992-some passer - by and throw [myself]121-kemp upon [his]1992-some passer - by mercy . But [I]121-kemp knew too clearly the terror and brutal cruelty [my]121-kemp advances would evoke . [I]121-kemp made no plans in [the street]439-the street . [My]121-kemp sole object was to get shelter from the snow , to get [myself]121-kemp covered and warm ; then [I]121-kemp might hope to plan . But even to [me]121-kemp , [an Invisible Man]1549-an invisible man , the rows of [London houses]1995-london houses stood latched , barred , and bolted impregnably .[121-kemp]

" Only one thing could [I]121-kemp see clearly before [me]121-kemp the cold exposure and misery of the snowstorm and the night .[121-kemp]

" And then [I]121-kemp had a brilliant idea . [I]121-kemp turned down [one of the roads leading from [Gower Street]43-gower street to [Tottenham Court Road]36-tottenham court road]1996-one of the roads leading from gower street to tottenham court road , and found [myself]121-kemp outside [Omniums]44-omniums , [the big establishment where everything is to be bought]1997-the big establishment where everything is to be bought [you]1998-you know [the place]351-the place : meat , grocery , linen , furniture , clothing , oil paintings even a huge meandering collection of [shops]827-shops rather than [a shop]1905-a shop . [I]121-kemp had thought [I]121-kemp should find the doors open , but they were closed , and as [I]121-kemp stood in the wide entrance [a carriage]1434-a carriage stopped outside , and [a man in uniform [you]1998-you know the kind of personage with Omnium on [his]2003-a man in uniform you know the kind of personage with omnium on his cap cap]2003-a man in uniform you know the kind of personage with omnium on his cap flung open the door . [I]121-kemp contrived to enter , and walking down [the shop]2004-the shop it was [a department where [they]2006-they were selling ribbons and gloves and stockings and that kind of thing]2005-a department where they were selling ribbons and gloves and stockings and that kind of thing came to [a more spacious region devoted to picnic baskets and wicker furniture]2007-a more spacious region devoted to picnic baskets and wicker furniture .[121-kemp]

" [I]121-kemp did not feel safe [there]1426-there , however ; [people]330-people were going to and fro , and [I]121-kemp prowled restlessly about until [I]121-kemp came upon [a huge section in an upper floor containing multitudes of bedsteads]2010-a huge section in an upper floor containing multitudes of bedsteads , and over these [I]121-kemp clambered , and found a resting - place at last among a huge pile of folded flock mattresses . [The place]351-the place was already lit up and agreeably warm , and [I]121-kemp decided to remain where [I]121-kemp was , keeping a cautious eye on [the two or three sets of [shopmen]2013-shopmen and [customers]2014-customers who were meandering through [the place]351-the place]2012-the two or three sets of shopmen and customers who were meandering through the place , until closing time came . Then [I]121-kemp should be able , [I]121-kemp thought , to rob [the place]351-the place for food and clothing , and disguised , prowl through [it]351-the place and examine [its]351-the place resources , perhaps sleep on some of the bedding . That seemed an acceptable plan . [My]121-kemp idea was to procure clothing to make [myself]121-kemp a muffled but acceptable figure , to get money , and then to recover [my]121-kemp books and parcels where [they]2017-they awaited [me]121-kemp , take a lodging somewhere and elaborate plans for the complete realisation of the advantages [my]121-kemp invisibility gave [me]121-kemp ( as [I]121-kemp still imagined ) over [[my]121-kemp fellow - men]1698-my fellow - men .[121-kemp]

" Closing time arrived quickly enough . It could not have been more than an hour after [I]121-kemp took up [my]121-kemp position on the mattresses before [I]121-kemp noticed the blinds of the windows being drawn , and [customers]2014-customers being marched doorward . And then [a number of [brisk young men]2021-brisk young men]2020-a number of brisk young men began with remarkable alacrity to tidy up the goods that remained disturbed . [I]121-kemp left [[my]121-kemp lair]2022-my lair as [the crowds]2023-the crowds diminished , and prowled cautiously out into [the less desolate parts of [the shop]2004-the shop]2024-the less desolate parts of the shop . [I]121-kemp was really surprised to observe how rapidly [the young men]1873-the young men and [women]1471-women whipped away the goods displayed for sale during the day . All the boxes of goods , the hanging fabrics , the festoons of lace , the boxes of sweets in [the grocery section]2028-the grocery section , the displays of this and that , were being whipped down , folded up , slapped into tidy receptacles , and everything that could not be taken down and put away had sheets of some coarse stuff like sacking flung over them . Finally all the chairs were turned up on to the counters , leaving the floor clear . Directly [each of [these young people]2030-these young people]2029-each of these young people had done , [he]2031-he or [she]2032-she made promptly for the door with such an expression of animation as [I]121-kemp have rarely observed in [a shop assistant]2033-a shop assistant before . Then came a lot of youngsters scattering sawdust and carrying pails and brooms . [I]121-kemp had to dodge to get out of the way , and as it was , [my]121-kemp ankle got stung with the sawdust . For some time , wandering through [the swathed and darkened departments]2034-the swathed and darkened departments , [I]121-kemp could hear the brooms at work . And at last a good hour or more after [the shop]2004-the shop had been closed , came a noise of locking doors . Silence came upon [the place]351-the place , and [I]121-kemp found [myself]121-kemp wandering through [the vast and intricate shops]2037-the vast and intricate shops , [galleries]2038-galleries , [show - rooms of [the place]351-the place]2039-show - rooms of the place , alone . It was very still ; in one place [I]121-kemp remember passing near one of [the Tottenham Court Road]36-tottenham court road entrances and listening to the tapping of boot - heels of [the passers - by]2041-the passers - by .[121-kemp]

" [My]121-kemp first visit was to [the place where [I]121-kemp had seen stockings and gloves for sale]2042-the place where i had seen stockings and gloves for sale . It was dark , and [I]121-kemp had the devil of a hunt after matches , which [I]121-kemp found at last in the drawer of the little cash desk . Then [I]121-kemp had to get a candle . [I]121-kemp had to tear down wrappings and ransack a number of boxes and drawers , but at last [I]121-kemp managed to turn out what [I]121-kemp sought ; the box label called them lambswool pants , and lambswool vests . Then socks , a thick comforter , and then [I]121-kemp went to [the clothing place]2043-the clothing place and got trousers , a lounge jacket , an overcoat and a slouch hat a clerical sort of hat with the brim turned down . [I]121-kemp began to feel [a human being]2044-a human being again , and [my]121-kemp next thought was food .[121-kemp]

" [Upstairs]256-upstairs was [a refreshment department]2046-a refreshment department , and there [I]121-kemp got cold meat . There was coffee still in the urn , and [I]121-kemp lit the gas and warmed it up again , and altogether [I]121-kemp did not do badly . Afterwards , prowling through [the place]351-the place in search of blankets [I]121-kemp had to put up at last with a heap of down quilts [I]121-kemp came upon [a grocery section]2048-a grocery section with a lot of chocolate and candied fruits , more than was good for [me]121-kemp indeed and some white burgundy . And near that was [a toy department]2049-a toy department , and [I]121-kemp had a brilliant idea . [I]121-kemp found some artificial noses dummy noses , [you]2050-you know , and [I]121-kemp thought of dark spectacles . But Omniums had no optical department . [My]121-kemp nose had been a difficulty indeed [I]121-kemp had thought of paint . But the discovery set [my]121-kemp mind running on wigs and masks and the like . Finally [I]121-kemp went to sleep in a heap of down quilts , very warm and comfortable .[121-kemp]

" [My]121-kemp last thoughts before sleeping were the most agreeable [I]121-kemp had had since the change . [I]121-kemp was in a state of physical serenity , and that was reflected in [my]121-kemp mind . [I]121-kemp thought that [I]121-kemp should be able to slip out unobserved in the morning with [my]121-kemp clothes upon [me]121-kemp , muffling [my]121-kemp face with a white wrapper [I]121-kemp had taken , purchase , with the money [I]121-kemp had taken , spectacles and so forth , and so complete [my]121-kemp disguise . [I]121-kemp lapsed into disorderly dreams of all the fantastic things that had happened during the last few days . [I]121-kemp saw [the ugly little Jew of a landlord vociferating in [[his]2051-the ugly little jew of a landlord vociferating in his rooms rooms]2052-his rooms]2051-the ugly little jew of a landlord vociferating in his rooms ; [I]121-kemp saw [[his]2051-the ugly little jew of a landlord vociferating in his rooms two sons]2053-his two sons marvelling , and [the wrinkled old woman]2054-the wrinkled old woman s gnarled face as [she]2054-the wrinkled old woman asked for [her]2054-the wrinkled old woman cat . [I]121-kemp experienced again the strange sensation of seeing the cloth disappear , and so [I]121-kemp came round to [the windy hillside]2055-the windy hillside and [the sniffing old clergyman]2056-the sniffing old clergyman mumbling Earth to earth , ashes to ashes , dust to dust , at [[my]121-kemp father]1760-my father s open grave .[121-kemp]

" [You]121-kemp also , said a voice , and suddenly [I]121-kemp was being forced towards [the grave]2058-the grave . [I]121-kemp struggled , shouted , appealed to [the mourners]2059-the mourners , but [they]2059-the mourners continued stonily following the service ; [the old clergyman]2060-the old clergyman , too , never faltered droning and sniffing through the ritual . [I]121-kemp realised [I]121-kemp was invisible and inaudible , that overwhelming forces had their grip on [me]121-kemp . [I]121-kemp struggled in vain , [I]121-kemp was forced over the brink , the coffin rang hollow as [I]121-kemp fell upon it , and the gravel came flying after [me]121-kemp in spadefuls . [Nobody]1514-nobody heeded [me]121-kemp , [nobody]1514-nobody was aware of [me]121-kemp . [I]121-kemp made convulsive struggles and awoke .[121-kemp]

" The pale London dawn had come , [the place]351-the place was full of a chilly grey light that filtered round the edges of the window blinds .
