[I]121-kemp sat up , and for a time [I]121-kemp could not think where [this ample apartment]2064-this ample apartment , with [its]2064-this ample apartment counters , [its]2064-this ample apartment piles of rolled stuff , [its]2064-this ample apartment heap of quilts and cushions , [its]2064-this ample apartment iron pillars , might be . Then , as recollection came back to [me]121-kemp , [I]121-kemp heard voices in conversation .[121-kemp]

" Then far down [the place]351-the place , in the brighter light of some department which had already raised [its]2064-this ample apartment blinds , [I]121-kemp saw [two men]2066-two men approaching . [I]121-kemp scrambled to [my]121-kemp feet , looking about [me]121-kemp for some way of escape , and even as [I]121-kemp did so the sound of [my]121-kemp movement made [them]2066-two men aware of [me]121-kemp . [I]121-kemp suppose [they]2066-two men saw merely [a figure moving quietly and quickly away]2067-a figure moving quietly and quickly away . Who s that ? cried [one]214-one , and Stop there ! shouted [the other]424-the other . [I]121-kemp dashed around a corner and came full tilt [a faceless figure]2070-a faceless figure , mind [you]2071-you ! on [a lanky lad of fifteen]2072-a lanky lad of fifteen . [He]2072-a lanky lad of fifteen yelled and [I]121-kemp bowled [him]2072-a lanky lad of fifteen over , rushed past [him]2072-a lanky lad of fifteen , turned another corner , and by a happy inspiration threw [myself]121-kemp behind a counter . In another moment feet went running past and [I]121-kemp heard voices shouting , All hands to the doors ! asking what was up , and giving [one another]213-one another advice how to catch [me]121-kemp .[121-kemp]

" Lying on the ground , [I]121-kemp felt scared out of [my]121-kemp wits . But odd as it may seem it did not occur to [me]121-kemp at the moment to take off [my]121-kemp clothes as [I]121-kemp should have done . [I]121-kemp had made up [my]121-kemp mind , [I]121-kemp suppose , to get away in them , and that ruled [me]121-kemp . And then down the vista of the counters came a bawling of Here [he]2072-a lanky lad of fifteen is ![121-kemp]

" [I]121-kemp sprang to [my]121-kemp feet , whipped a chair off the counter , and sent it whirling at [the fool who had shouted , turned , came into another round a corner]2074-the fool who had shouted , turned , came into another round a corner , sent [him]2072-a lanky lad of fifteen spinning , and rushed up [the stairs]971-the stairs . [He]2072-a lanky lad of fifteen kept [his]2072-a lanky lad of fifteen footing , gave a view hallo , and came up the staircase hot after [me]121-kemp . Up the staircase were piled a multitude of those bright - coloured pot things what are they ? "[121-kemp]

" Art pots , "[121-kemp] suggested [Kemp]121-kemp .

" That s it ! Art pots . Well , [I]121-kemp turned at the top step and swung round , plucked one out of a pile and smashed it on [his]2072-a lanky lad of fifteen silly head as [he]2072-a lanky lad of fifteen came at [me]121-kemp . The whole pile of pots went headlong , and [I]121-kemp heard shouting and footsteps running from all parts . [I]121-kemp made a mad rush for [the refreshment place]2076-the refreshment place , and there was a man in white like [a man cook]2077-a man cook , who took up the chase . [I]121-kemp made one last desperate turn and found [myself]121-kemp among lamps and [ironmongery]2078-ironmongery . [I]121-kemp went behind the counter of this , and waited for [[my]121-kemp cook]2079-my cook , and as [he]2079-my cook bolted in at the head of the chase , [I]121-kemp doubled [him]2079-my cook up with a lamp . Down [he]2079-my cook went , and [I]121-kemp crouched down behind the counter and began whipping off [my]121-kemp clothes as fast as [I]121-kemp could . Coat , jacket , trousers , shoes were all right , but a lambswool vest fits [a man like a skin]2080-a man like a skin . [I]121-kemp heard [more men]2081-more men coming , [[my]121-kemp cook]2079-my cook was lying quiet on the other side of the counter , stunned or scared speechless , and [I]121-kemp had to make another dash for it , like a rabbit hunted out of a wood - pile .[121-kemp]

" This way , [policeman]904-policeman ! [I]121-kemp heard [someone]428-someone shouting . [I]121-kemp found [myself]121-kemp in [[my]121-kemp bedstead storeroom]2085-my bedstead storeroom again , and at the end of a wilderness of wardrobes . [I]121-kemp rushed among [them]2081-more men , went flat , got rid of [my]121-kemp vest after infinite wriggling , and stood [a free man]2086-a free man again , panting and scared , as [the policeman]884-the policeman and [three of [the shopmen]2089-the shopmen]2088-three of the shopmen came round [the corner]2090-the corner . [They]2081-more men made a rush for the vest and pants , and collared the trousers . [He]2086-a free man s dropping [his]2086-a free man plunder , said [one of [the young men]1873-the young men]1872-one of the young men . [He]2086-a free man _ must _ be somewhere here .[121-kemp]

" But [they]2081-more men did not find [me]121-kemp all the same .[121-kemp]

" [I]121-kemp stood watching [them]2081-more men hunt for [me]121-kemp for a time , and cursing [my]121-kemp ill - luck in losing the clothes . Then [I]121-kemp went into [the refreshment - room]2093-the refreshment - room , drank a little milk [I]121-kemp found there , and sat down by the fire to consider [my]121-kemp position .[121-kemp]

" In a little while [two assistants]2094-two assistants came in and began to talk over the business very excitedly and like [the fools]2095-the fools [they]2094-two assistants were . [I]121-kemp heard a magnified account of [my]121-kemp depredations , and other speculations as to [my]121-kemp whereabouts . Then [I]121-kemp fell to scheming again . The insurmountable difficulty of [the place]351-the place , especially now it was alarmed , was to get any plunder out of [it]351-the place . [I]121-kemp went down into [the warehouse]2097-the warehouse to see if there was any chance of packing and addressing a parcel , but [I]121-kemp could not understand the system of checking . About eleven o clock , the snow having thawed as it fell , and the day being finer and a little warmer than the previous one , [I]121-kemp decided that [the Emporium]1040-the emporium was hopeless , and went out again , exasperated at [my]121-kemp want of success , with only the vaguest plans of action in [my]121-kemp mind . "[121-kemp]

CHAPTER XXIII . IN DRURY LANE

" But [you]121-kemp begin now to realise , "[105-the invisible man] said [the Invisible Man]105-the invisible man , " the full disadvantage of [my]105-the invisible man condition . [I]105-the invisible man had no shelter no covering to get clothing was to forego all [my]105-the invisible man advantage , to make [myself]105-the invisible man a strange and terrible thing . [I]105-the invisible man was fasting ; for to eat , to fill [myself]105-the invisible man with unassimilated matter , would be to become grotesquely visible again . "[105-the invisible man]

" [I]121-kemp never thought of that , "[121-kemp] said [Kemp]121-kemp .

" Nor had [I.]121-kemp And the snow had warned [me]121-kemp of other dangers . [I]121-kemp could not go abroad in snow it would settle on [me]121-kemp and expose [me]121-kemp . Rain , too , would make [me]121-kemp a watery outline , a glistening surface of [a man]1463-a man a bubble . And fog [I]121-kemp should be like a fainter bubble in a fog , a surface , a greasy glimmer of humanity . Moreover , as [I]121-kemp went abroad in the [London]20-london air [I]121-kemp gathered dirt about [my]121-kemp ankles , floating smuts and dust upon [my]121-kemp skin . [I]121-kemp did not know how long it would be before [I]121-kemp should become visible from that cause also . But [I]121-kemp saw clearly it could not be for long .[121-kemp]

" Not in [London]20-london at any rate .[121-kemp]

" [I]121-kemp went into [the slums]2100-the slums towards [Great Portland Street]30-great portland street , and found [myself]121-kemp at the end of [the street in which [I]121-kemp had lodged]2101-the street in which i had lodged . [I]121-kemp did not go that way , because of the crowd halfway down [it]2101-the street in which i had lodged opposite to [the still smoking ruins of [the house [I]121-kemp had fired]2103-the house i had fired]2102-the still smoking ruins of the house i had fired . [My]121-kemp most immediate problem was to get clothing . What to do with [my]121-kemp face puzzled [me]121-kemp . Then [I]121-kemp saw in one of [those little miscellaneous shops]2104-those little miscellaneous shops news , sweets , toys , stationery , belated Christmas tomfoolery , and so forth an array of masks and noses . [I]121-kemp realised that problem was solved . In a flash [I]121-kemp saw [my]121-kemp course . [I]121-kemp turned about , no longer aimless , and went circuitously in order to avoid the busy ways , towards [the back streets north of [the Strand]46-the strand]2105-the back streets north of the strand ; for [I]121-kemp remembered , though not very distinctly where , that [some theatrical costumiers]2106-some theatrical costumiers had [shops in [that district]2108-that district]2107-shops in that district .[121-kemp]

" The day was cold , with a nipping wind down [the northward running streets]2109-the northward running streets . [I]121-kemp walked fast to avoid being overtaken . [Every crossing]2110-every crossing was a danger , [every passenger]2111-every passenger a thing to watch alertly . [One man]2112-one man as [I]121-kemp was about to pass [him]2112-one man at [the top of [Bedford Street]47-bedford street]2113-the top of bedford street , turned upon [me]121-kemp abruptly and came into [me]121-kemp , sending [me]121-kemp into [the road]262-the road and almost under the wheel of a passing hansom . The verdict of [the cab - rank]2115-the cab - rank was that [he]2112-one man had had some sort of stroke . [I]121-kemp was so unnerved by this encounter that [I]121-kemp went into [Covent Garden Market]48-covent garden market and sat down for some time in a quiet corner by a stall of violets , panting and trembling . [I]121-kemp found [I]121-kemp had caught a fresh cold , and had to turn out after a time lest [my]121-kemp sneezes should attract attention .[121-kemp]

" At last [I]121-kemp reached the object of [my]121-kemp quest , [a dirty , fly - blown little shop in a by - way near [Drury Lane]49-drury lane]2116-a dirty , fly - blown little shop in a by - way near drury lane , with a window full of tinsel robes , sham jewels , wigs , slippers , dominoes and theatrical photographs . [The shop]2004-the shop was old - fashioned and low and dark , and [the house]396-the house rose above [it]2004-the shop for four storeys , dark and dismal . [I]121-kemp peered through the window and , seeing [no one within]2119-no one within , entered . The opening of the door set a clanking bell ringing . [I]121-kemp left it open , and walked round a bare costume stand , into a corner behind a cheval glass . For a minute or so [no one]248-no one came . Then [I]121-kemp heard heavy feet striding across [a room]1415-a room , and [a man]1463-a man appeared down [the shop]2004-the shop .[121-kemp]

" [My]121-kemp plans were now perfectly definite . [I]121-kemp proposed to make [my]121-kemp way into [the house]396-the house , secrete [myself]121-kemp [upstairs]256-upstairs , watch [my]121-kemp opportunity , and when everything was quiet , rummage out a wig , mask , spectacles , and costume , and go into [the world]547-the world , perhaps [a grotesque but still a credible figure]2127-a grotesque but still a credible figure . And incidentally of course [I]121-kemp could rob [the house]396-the house of any available money .[121-kemp]

" [The man who had just entered [the shop]2004-the shop]2129-the man who had just entered the shop was [a short , slight , hunched , beetle - browed man , with long arms and very short bandy legs]2131-a short , slight , hunched , beetle - browed man , with long arms and very short bandy legs . Apparently [I]121-kemp had interrupted a meal . [He]2129-the man who had just entered the shop stared about [the shop]2004-the shop with an expression of expectation . This gave way to surprise , and then to anger , as [he]2129-the man who had just entered the shop saw [the shop]2004-the shop empty . Damn [the boys]483-the boys ! [he]2129-the man who had just entered the shop said . [He]2129-the man who had just entered the shop went to stare up and down [the street]439-the street . [He]2129-the man who had just entered the shop came in again in a minute , kicked the door to with [his]2129-the man who had just entered the shop foot spitefully , and went muttering back to the house door .[121-kemp]

" [I]121-kemp came forward to follow [him]2129-the man who had just entered the shop , and at the noise of [my]121-kemp movement [he]2129-the man who had just entered the shop stopped dead . [I]121-kemp did so too , startled by [his]2129-the man who had just entered the shop quickness of ear . [He]2129-the man who had just entered the shop slammed the house door in [my]121-kemp face .[121-kemp]

" [I]121-kemp stood hesitating . Suddenly [I]121-kemp heard [his]2129-the man who had just entered the shop quick footsteps returning , and the door reopened . [He]2129-the man who had just entered the shop stood looking about [the shop]2004-the shop like one who was still not satisfied . Then , murmuring to [himself]2129-the man who had just entered the shop , [he]2129-the man who had just entered the shop examined the back of the counter and peered behind some fixtures . Then [he]2129-the man who had just entered the shop stood doubtful . [He]2129-the man who had just entered the shop had left the house door open and [I]121-kemp slipped into [the inner room]2137-the inner room .[121-kemp]

" It was [a queer little room]2138-a queer little room , poorly furnished and with a number of big masks in the corner . On the table was [his]2129-the man who had just entered the shop belated breakfast , and it was a confoundedly exasperating thing for [me]121-kemp , [Kemp]121-kemp , to have to sniff [his]2129-the man who had just entered the shop coffee and stand watching while [he]2129-the man who had just entered the shop came in and resumed [his]2129-the man who had just entered the shop meal . And [his]2129-the man who had just entered the shop table manners were irritating . Three doors opened into [the little room]2139-the little room , one going [upstairs]256-upstairs and one down , but [they]2141-they were all shut . [I]121-kemp could not get out of [the room]1421-the room while [he]2129-the man who had just entered the shop was [there]1426-there ; [I]121-kemp could scarcely move because of [his]2129-the man who had just entered the shop alertness , and there was a draught down [my]121-kemp back . Twice [I]121-kemp strangled a sneeze just in time .[121-kemp]

" The spectacular quality of [my]121-kemp sensations was curious and novel , but for all that [I]121-kemp was heartily tired and angry long before [he]2129-the man who had just entered the shop had done [his]2129-the man who had just entered the shop eating . But at last [he]2129-the man who had just entered the shop made an end and putting [his]2129-the man who had just entered the shop beggarly crockery on the black tin tray upon which [he]2129-the man who had just entered the shop had had [his]2129-the man who had just entered the shop teapot , and gathering all the crumbs up on the mustard stained cloth , [he]2129-the man who had just entered the shop took the whole lot of things after [him]2129-the man who had just entered the shop . [His]2129-the man who had just entered the shop burden prevented [his]2129-the man who had just entered the shop shutting the door behind [him]2129-the man who had just entered the shop as [he]2129-the man who had just entered the shop would have done ; [I]121-kemp never saw [such a man]2144-such a man for shutting doors and [I]121-kemp followed [him]2129-the man who had just entered the shop into [a very dirty underground kitchen]2145-a very dirty underground kitchen and [scullery]2146-scullery . [I]121-kemp had the pleasure of seeing [him]2129-the man who had just entered the shop begin to wash up , and then , finding no good in keeping down there , and the brick floor being cold on [my]121-kemp feet , [I]121-kemp returned [upstairs]256-upstairs and sat in [his]2129-the man who had just entered the shop chair by the fire . It was burning low , and scarcely thinking , [I]121-kemp put on a little coal . The noise of this brought [him]2129-the man who had just entered the shop up at once , and [he]2129-the man who had just entered the shop stood aglare . [He]2129-the man who had just entered the shop peered about [the room]1421-the room and was within an ace of touching [me]121-kemp . Even after that examination , [he]2129-the man who had just entered the shop scarcely seemed satisfied . [He]2129-the man who had just entered the shop stopped in the doorway and took a final inspection before [he]2129-the man who had just entered the shop went down .[121-kemp]

" [I]121-kemp waited in [the little parlour]2149-the little parlour for an age , and at last [he]2129-the man who had just entered the shop came up and opened the upstairs door . [I]121-kemp just managed to get by [him]2129-the man who had just entered the shop .[121-kemp]

" On the staircase [he]2129-the man who had just entered the shop stopped suddenly , so that [I]121-kemp very nearly blundered into [him]2129-the man who had just entered the shop . [He]2129-the man who had just entered the shop stood looking back right into [my]121-kemp face and listening . [I]121-kemp could have sworn , [he]2129-the man who had just entered the shop said . [His]2129-the man who had just entered the shop long hairy hand pulled at [his]2129-the man who had just entered the shop lower lip . [His]2129-the man who had just entered the shop eye went up and down [the staircase]2150-the staircase . Then [he]2129-the man who had just entered the shop grunted and went on up again .[121-kemp]

" [His]2129-the man who had just entered the shop hand was on the handle of a door , and then [he]2129-the man who had just entered the shop stopped again with the same puzzled anger on [his]2129-the man who had just entered the shop face . [He]2129-the man who had just entered the shop was becoming aware of the faint sounds of [my]121-kemp movements about [him]2129-the man who had just entered the shop . [The man]345-the man must have had diabolically acute hearing . [He]2129-the man who had just entered the shop suddenly flashed into rage . If there s anyone in [this house]1520-this house [he]2129-the man who had just entered the shop cried with an oath , and left the threat unfinished . [He]2129-the man who had just entered the shop put [his]2129-the man who had just entered the shop hand in [his]2129-the man who had just entered the shop pocket , failed to find what [he]2129-the man who had just entered the shop wanted , and rushing past [me]121-kemp went blundering noisily and pugnaciously [downstairs]377-downstairs . But [I]121-kemp did not follow [him]2129-the man who had just entered the shop . [I]121-kemp sat on the head of [the staircase]2150-the staircase until [his]2129-the man who had just entered the shop return .[121-kemp]

" Presently [he]2129-the man who had just entered the shop came up again , still muttering . [He]2129-the man who had just entered the shop opened the door of [the room]1421-the room , and before [I]121-kemp could enter , slammed it in [my]121-kemp face .[121-kemp]

" [I]121-kemp resolved to explore [the house]396-the house , and spent some time in doing so as noiselessly as possible . [The house]396-the house was very old and tumble - down , damp so that the paper in [the attics]2158-the attics was peeling from the walls , and rat infested . Some of the door handles were stiff and [I]121-kemp was afraid to turn them . [Several rooms]2159-several rooms [I]121-kemp did inspect were unfurnished , and others were littered with theatrical lumber , bought second - hand , [I]121-kemp judged , from [its]396-the house appearance . In [one room next to [his]2129-the man who had just entered the shop [I]121-kemp]2160-one room next to his i found a lot of old clothes . [I]121-kemp began routing among these , and in [my]121-kemp eagerness forgot again the evident sharpness of [his]2129-the man who had just entered the shop ears . [I]121-kemp heard a stealthy footstep and , looking up just in time , saw [him]2129-the man who had just entered the shop peering in at the tumbled heap and holding an old - fashioned revolver in [his]2129-the man who had just entered the shop hand . [I]121-kemp stood perfectly still while [he]2129-the man who had just entered the shop stared about open - mouthed and suspicious . It must have been [her]2161-her , [he]2129-the man who had just entered the shop said slowly . Damn [her]2161-her ![121-kemp]

" [He]2129-the man who had just entered the shop shut the door quietly , and immediately [I]121-kemp heard the key turn in the lock . Then [his]2129-the man who had just entered the shop footsteps retreated . [I]121-kemp realised abruptly that [I]121-kemp was locked in . For a minute [I]121-kemp did not know what to do . [I]121-kemp walked from door to window and back , and stood perplexed . A gust of anger came upon [me]121-kemp . But [I]121-kemp decided to inspect the clothes before [I]121-kemp did anything further , and [my]121-kemp first attempt brought down a pile from an upper shelf . [I]121-kemp could go forth into [the world]547-the world again , equipped .[121-kemp]

" Then came a curious hesitation . Was [my]121-kemp appearance really credible ? " Oh ! disillusionment again . [I]1042-i thought [my]1042-i troubles were over . Practically [I]1042-i thought [I]1042-i had impunity to do whatever [I]1042-i chose , everything save to give away [my]1042-i secret . So [I]1042-i thought . Whatever [I]1042-i did , whatever the consequences might be , was nothing to [me]1042-i . [I]1042-i had merely to fling aside [my]1042-i garments and vanish . [No person]2204-no person could hold [me]1042-i . [I]1042-i could take [my]1042-i money where [I]1042-i found it . "[1042-i]

" The more [I]121-kemp thought it over , [Kemp]121-kemp , the more [I]121-kemp realised what a helpless absurdity [an Invisible Man]1549-an invisible man was in a cold and dirty climate and [a crowded civilised city]2212-a crowded civilised city . CHAPTER XXIV . THE PLAN THAT FAILED

" But now , "[121-kemp] said [Kemp]121-kemp , with a side glance out of the window , " what are [we]2225-we to do ? "[121-kemp]

[He]121-kemp moved nearer [[his]121-kemp guest]227-his guest as [he]121-kemp spoke in such a manner as to prevent the possibility of a sudden glimpse of [the three men who were advancing up [the hill road]665-the hill road]1048-the three men who were advancing up the hill road with an intolerable slowness , as it seemed to [Kemp]121-kemp .

" What were [you]121-kemp planning to do when [you]121-kemp were heading for [Port Burdock]122-port burdock ? _ Had _ [you]121-kemp any plan ? "[1048-the three men who were advancing up the hill road]

" [I]1048-the three men who were advancing up the hill road was going to clear out of [the country]1626-the country . But [I]1048-the three men who were advancing up the hill road have altered that plan rather since seeing [you]121-kemp . [I]1048-the three men who were advancing up the hill road thought it would be wise , now the weather is hot and invisibility possible , to make for [the South]52-the south . Especially as [my]1048-the three men who were advancing up the hill road secret was known , and [everyone]249-everyone would be on the lookout for [a masked and muffled man]2228-a masked and muffled man . [You]121-kemp have a line of [steamers from]2229-steamers from [here]1660-here to [France]53-france . [My]1048-the three men who were advancing up the hill road idea was to get aboard one and run the risks of the passage . Thence [I]1048-the three men who were advancing up the hill road could go by [train]2231-train into [Spain]54-spain , or else get to [Algiers]55-algiers . It would not be difficult . There [a man]1463-a man might always be invisible and yet live . And do things . "[1048-the three men who were advancing up the hill road]

" That s clear . "[1048-the three men who were advancing up the hill road]

" [No one]248-no one ? "[131-griffin] insisted [Griffin]131-griffin .

" Not [a soul]2245-a soul . "[1051-akimbo]

" Ah ! Now "[105-the invisible man] [The Invisible Man]105-the invisible man stood up , and sticking [his]105-the invisible man arms [akimbo]1051-akimbo began to pace [the study]373-the study .

" [I]1051-akimbo made a mistake , [Kemp]121-kemp , a huge mistake , in carrying this thing through alone . [I]1051-akimbo have wasted strength , time , opportunities . " What [I]1051-akimbo want , [Kemp]121-kemp , is a goal - keeper , [a helper]2247-a helper , and [a hiding - place]2248-a hiding - place , an arrangement whereby [I]1051-akimbo can sleep and eat and rest in peace , and unsuspected . " Hitherto [I]1051-akimbo have gone on vague lines . [We]2250-we have to consider all that invisibility means , all that it does not mean . It means little advantage for eavesdropping and so forth [one]214-one makes sounds . It s of little help a little help perhaps in housebreaking and so forth . Once [you]2252-you ve caught [me]1051-akimbo [you]2252-you could easily imprison [me]1051-akimbo . But on the other hand [I]1051-akimbo am hard to catch . This invisibility , in fact , is only good in two cases : It s useful in getting away , it s useful in approaching . It s particularly useful , therefore , in killing . [I]1051-akimbo can walk round [a man]1463-a man , whatever weapon [he]1463-a man has , choose [my]1051-akimbo point , strike as [I]1051-akimbo like . Dodge as [I]1051-akimbo like . " And it is killing [we]2250-we must do , [Kemp]121-kemp . "[1051-akimbo]

" It is killing [we]2250-we must do , "[121-kemp] repeated [Kemp]121-kemp . " [I]121-kemp m listening to [your]121-kemp plan , [Griffin]131-griffin , but [I]121-kemp m not agreeing , mind . _ Why _ killing ? "[121-kemp]

" Not wanton killing , but a judicious slaying . The point is , [they]2254-they know there is [an Invisible Man]1549-an invisible man as well as [we]2250-we know there is [an Invisible Man]1549-an invisible man . And [that Invisible Man]2257-that invisible man , [Kemp]121-kemp , must now establish a Reign of Terror . Yes ; no doubt it s startling . But [I]1051-akimbo mean it . A Reign of Terror . [He]2257-that invisible man must take [some town like [your]121-kemp [Burdock]122-port burdock]2258-some town like your burdock and terrify and dominate it . [He]2257-that invisible man must issue [his]2257-that invisible man orders . [He]2257-that invisible man can do that in a thousand ways scraps of paper thrust under doors would suffice . And all who disobey [his]2257-that invisible man orders [he]2257-that invisible man must kill , and kill all who would defend [them]2259-them . "[1051-akimbo]

" Humph ! "[121-kemp] said [Kemp]121-kemp , no longer listening to [Griffin]131-griffin but to the sound of [his]121-kemp front door opening and closing .

" It seems to [me]121-kemp , [Griffin]131-griffin , "[121-kemp] [he]121-kemp said , to cover [his]121-kemp wandering attention , " that [[your]131-griffin confederate]2260-your confederate would be in a difficult position . "[121-kemp]

" [No one]248-no one would know [he]2260-your confederate was [a confederate]2262-a confederate , "[105-the invisible man] said [the Invisible Man]105-the invisible man , eagerly . And then suddenly , " Hush ! What s that [downstairs]377-downstairs ? "[121-kemp]

" Nothing , "[121-kemp] said [Kemp]121-kemp , and suddenly began to speak loud and fast . " [I]121-kemp don t agree to this , [Griffin]131-griffin , "[121-kemp] [he]121-kemp said . " Understand [me]121-kemp , [I]121-kemp don t agree to this . Why dream of playing a game against the race ? How can [you]131-griffin hope to gain happiness ? Don t be [a lone wolf]2264-a lone wolf . Think what [you]131-griffin might do with [a million helpers]2267-a million helpers "[121-kemp]

[The Invisible Man]105-the invisible man interrupted arm extended . " There are footsteps coming [upstairs]256-upstairs , "[105-the invisible man] [he]105-the invisible man said in a low voice .

" Nonsense , "[121-kemp] said [Kemp]121-kemp .

" Let [me]105-the invisible man see , "[105-the invisible man] said [the Invisible Man]105-the invisible man , and advanced , arm extended , to the door .

And then things happened very swiftly . [Kemp]121-kemp hesitated for a second and then moved to intercept [him]105-the invisible man . [The Invisible Man]105-the invisible man started and stood still . " [Traitor]2269-traitor ! "[601-the voice] cried [the Voice]601-the voice , and suddenly the dressing - gown opened , and sitting down [the Unseen]111-the unseen began to disrobe . [Kemp]121-kemp made three swift steps to the door , and forthwith [the Invisible Man]150-the invisible man [his]150-the invisible man legs had vanished sprang to [his]150-the invisible man feet with a shout . [Kemp]121-kemp flung the door open .

As it opened , there came a sound of hurrying feet [downstairs]377-downstairs and voices .

With a quick movement [Kemp]121-kemp thrust [the Invisible Man]105-the invisible man back , sprang aside , and slammed the door . The key was outside and ready . In another moment [Griffin]131-griffin would have been alone in [the belvedere study]1024-the belvedere study , [a prisoner]1058-a prisoner . Save for one little thing . The key had been slipped in hastily that morning . As [Kemp]121-kemp slammed the door it fell noisily upon the carpet .

[Kemp]121-kemp s face became white . [He]121-kemp tried to grip the door handle with both hands . For a moment [he]121-kemp stood lugging . Then the door gave six inches . But [he]121-kemp got it closed again . The second time it was jerked a foot wide , and the dressing - gown came wedging itself into the opening . [His]121-kemp throat was gripped by invisible fingers , and [he]121-kemp left [his]121-kemp hold on the handle to defend [himself]121-kemp . [He]121-kemp was forced back , tripped and pitched heavily into the corner of [the landing]368-the landing . The empty dressing - gown was flung on the top of [him]121-kemp .

Halfway up [the staircase]2150-the staircase was [Colonel Adye]133-adye , [the recipient of [Kemp]121-kemp]1061-the recipient of kemp s letter , [the chief of [the Burdock police]1063-the burdock police]1062-the chief of the burdock police . [He]121-kemp was staring aghast at the sudden appearance of [Kemp]121-kemp , followed by the extraordinary sight of clothing tossing empty in the air . [He]121-kemp saw [Kemp]121-kemp felled , and struggling to [his]121-kemp feet . [He]121-kemp saw [him]121-kemp rush forward , and go down again , felled like an ox .

Then suddenly [he]121-kemp was struck violently . By nothing ! A vast weight , it seemed , leapt upon [him]121-kemp , and [he]121-kemp was hurled headlong down [the staircase]2150-the staircase , with a grip on [his]121-kemp throat and a knee in [his]121-kemp groin . An invisible foot trod on [his]121-kemp back , a ghostly patter passed [downstairs]377-downstairs , [he]121-kemp heard [the two police officers in]1066-the two police officers in [the hall]346-the hall shout and run , and the front door of [the house]396-the house slammed violently .

[He]121-kemp rolled over and sat up staring . [He]121-kemp saw , staggering down [the staircase]2150-the staircase , [Kemp]121-kemp , dusty and disheveled , one side of [his]121-kemp face white from a blow , [his]121-kemp lip bleeding , and a pink dressing - gown and some underclothing held in [his]121-kemp arms .

" [[My]121-kemp God]2270-my god ! "[121-kemp] cried [Kemp]121-kemp , " the game s up ! [He]121-kemp s gone ! "[121-kemp]

CHAPTER XXV . THE HUNTING OF [THE INVISIBLE MAN]150-the invisible man

For a space [Kemp]121-kemp was too inarticulate to make [Adye]133-adye understand the swift things that had just happened . [They]1071-they stood on [the landing]368-the landing , [Kemp]121-kemp speaking swiftly , the grotesque swathings of [Griffin]131-griffin still on [his]121-kemp arm . But presently [Adye]133-adye began to grasp something of the situation .

" [He]121-kemp is mad , "[121-kemp] said [Kemp]121-kemp ; " inhuman . [He]121-kemp is pure selfishness . [He]121-kemp thinks of nothing but [his]121-kemp own advantage , [his]121-kemp own safety . [I]121-kemp have listened to such a story this morning of brutal self - seeking .... [He]121-kemp has wounded [men]572-men . [He]121-kemp will kill [them]572-men unless [we]1071-they can prevent [him]121-kemp . [He]121-kemp will create a panic . Nothing can stop [him]121-kemp . [He]121-kemp is going out now furious ! "[121-kemp]

" [He]121-kemp must be caught , "[133-adye] said [Adye]133-adye . " That is certain . "[133-adye]

" But how ? "[121-kemp] cried [Kemp]121-kemp , and suddenly became full of ideas . " [You]121-kemp must begin at once . [You]121-kemp must set [every available man]2272-every available man to work ; [you]121-kemp must prevent [his]121-kemp leaving [this district]2273-this district . Once [he]121-kemp gets away , [he]121-kemp may go through [the countryside]2274-the countryside as [he]121-kemp wills , killing and maiming . [He]121-kemp dreams of a reign of terror ! A reign of terror , [I]121-kemp tell [you]121-kemp . [You]121-kemp must set a watch on [trains]2275-trains and [roads]2276-roads and [shipping]2277-shipping . [The garrison]2278-the garrison must help . [You]121-kemp must wire for help . The only thing that may keep [him]121-kemp [here]1660-here is the thought of recovering some books of notes [he]121-kemp counts of value . [I]121-kemp will tell [you]121-kemp of that ! There is [a man in [[your]121-kemp police station]2281-your police station]2280-a man in your police station [Marvel]73-mr. marvel . "[121-kemp]

" [I]133-adye know , "[133-adye] said [Adye]133-adye , " [I]133-adye know . Those books yes . But [the tramp]1713-the tramp .... "[133-adye]

" Says [he]121-kemp hasn t them . But [he]121-kemp thinks [the tramp]1713-the tramp has . And [you]121-kemp must prevent [him]121-kemp from eating or sleeping ; day and night [the country]1626-the country must be astir for [him]121-kemp . [Heaven]120-heaven send [us]2286-we cold nights and rain ! [The whole country - side]2287-the whole country - side must begin hunting and keep hunting . [I]121-kemp tell [you]121-kemp , [Adye]133-adye , [he]121-kemp is a danger , a disaster ; unless [he]121-kemp is pinned and secured , it is frightful to think of the things that may happen . "[121-kemp]

" What else can [we]2286-we do ? "[133-adye] said [Adye]133-adye . " [I]133-adye must go down at once and begin organising . But why not come ? Yes [you]121-kemp come too ! In another moment [Adye]133-adye was leading the way [downstairs]377-downstairs . [They]1074-they found the front door open and [the policemen standing outside]1075-the policemen standing outside staring at empty air . " [He]121-kemp s got away , [sir]1417-sir , "[214-one] said [one]214-one .

" [We]2286-we must go to [the central station]2290-the central station at once , "[133-adye] said [Adye]133-adye . " One of [you]121-kemp go on down and get [a cab]2291-a cab to come up and meet [us]2286-we quickly . And now , [Kemp]121-kemp , what else ? "[133-adye]

" Dogs , "[121-kemp] said [Kemp]121-kemp . " [Get dogs]2292-get dogs . [They]2292-get dogs don t see [him]121-kemp , but [they]2292-get dogs wind [him]121-kemp . [Get dogs]2292-get dogs . "[121-kemp]

" [Bear]2296-bear in mind , "[121-kemp] said [Kemp]121-kemp , " [his]121-kemp food shows . After eating , [his]121-kemp food shows until it is assimilated . [He]121-kemp can t carry such things for long . And what [he]121-kemp can snatch up and strike [men]572-men with must be hidden away . "[121-kemp]

" Good again , "[133-adye] said [Adye]133-adye . " [We]2299-we shall have [him]121-kemp yet ! "[133-adye]

" And on [the roads]1776-the roads , "[121-kemp] said [Kemp]121-kemp , and hesitated .

CHAPTER XXVI . [THE WICKSTEED MURDER

The Invisible Man]141-the invisible man seems to have rushed out of [[Kemp]121-kemp s house]1077-kemp s house in a state of blind fury . [A little child]1078-a little child playing near [Kemp]121-kemp s gateway was violently caught up and thrown aside , so that its ankle was broken , and thereafter for some hours [the Invisible Man]141-the invisible man passed out of human perceptions . [No one]248-no one knows where [he]141-the invisible man went nor what [he]141-the invisible man did . But [one]214-one can imagine [him]141-the invisible man hurrying through the hot [June forenoon]58-june forenoon , up [the hill]592-the hill and on to [the open downland behind [Port Burdock]122-port burdock]1082-the open downland behind port burdock , raging and despairing at [his]141-the invisible man intolerable fate , and sheltering at last , heated and weary , amid [the thickets of [Hintondean]59-hintondean]1083-the thickets of hintondean , to piece together again [his]141-the invisible man shattered schemes against [his]141-the invisible man species . That seems the most probable refuge for [him]141-the invisible man , for there it was [he]141-the invisible man re - asserted [himself]141-the invisible man in a grimly tragical manner about two in the afternoon .

One wonders what [his]141-the invisible man state of mind may have been during that time , and what plans [he]141-the invisible man devised . No doubt [he]141-the invisible man was almost ecstatically exasperated by [Kemp]121-kemp s treachery , and though [we]1084-we may be able to understand the motives that led to that deceit , [we]1084-we may still imagine and even sympathise a little with the fury the attempted surprise must have occasioned . Perhaps something of the stunned astonishment of [his]141-the invisible man Oxford Street experiences may have returned to [him]141-the invisible man , for [he]141-the invisible man had evidently counted on [Kemp]121-kemp s co - operation in [his]121-kemp brutal dream of [a terrorised world]1085-a terrorised world . At any rate [he]141-the invisible man vanished from human ken about midday , and [no living witness]1086-no living witness can tell what [he]141-the invisible man did until about half - past two . It was a fortunate thing , perhaps , for [humanity]1087-humanity , but for [him]141-the invisible man it was a fatal inaction .

During that time [a growing multitude of men scattered over [the countryside]2274-the countryside]1088-a growing multitude of men scattered over the countryside were busy . In the morning [he]141-the invisible man had still been simply [a legend]1090-a legend , [a terror]1091-a terror ; in the afternoon , by virtue chiefly of [Kemp]121-kemp s drily worded proclamation , [he]141-the invisible man was presented as [a tangible antagonist]1092-a tangible antagonist , to be wounded , captured , or overcome , and [the countryside]2274-the countryside began organising itself with inconceivable rapidity . By two o clock even [he]141-the invisible man might still have removed [himself]141-the invisible man out of [the district]586-the district by getting aboard [a train]1095-a train , but after two that became impossible . [Every passenger train along [the lines on a great parallelogram between [Southampton]60-southampton , [Manchester]61-manchester , [Brighton]62-brighton and [Horsham]63-horsham]1097-the lines on a great parallelogram between southampton , manchester , brighton and horsham]1096-every passenger train along the lines on a great parallelogram between southampton , manchester , brighton and horsham , travelled with locked doors , and the goods traffic was almost entirely suspended . And in a great circle of twenty miles round [Port Burdock]122-port burdock , [men armed with guns and bludgeons]1098-men armed with guns and bludgeons were presently setting out in [groups of three and four , with dogs]1099-groups of three and four , with dogs , to beat [the roads]1776-the roads and [fields]1101-fields .

[Mounted policemen]1102-mounted policemen rode along [the country lanes]1103-the country lanes , stopping at [every cottage]1104-every cottage and warning [the people]858-the people to lock up [[their]858-the people houses]1106-their houses , and keep indoors unless [they]858-the people were armed , and all [the elementary schools]1107-the elementary schools had broken up by three o clock , and [the children , scared and keeping together in groups]1108-the children , scared and keeping together in groups , were hurrying [home]1466-home . [Kemp]121-kemp s proclamation signed indeed by [Adye]133-adye was posted over almost [the whole district]1110-the whole district by four or five o clock in the afternoon . It gave briefly but clearly all the conditions of the struggle , the necessity of keeping [the Invisible Man]150-the invisible man from food and sleep , the necessity for incessant watchfulness and for a prompt attention to any evidence of [his]150-the invisible man movements . And so swift and decided was the action of [the authorities]1112-the authorities , so prompt and universal was the belief in [this strange being]1113-this strange being , that before nightfall [an area of several hundred square miles]1114-an area of several hundred square miles was in a stringent state of siege . And before nightfall , too , a thrill of horror went through [the whole watching nervous countryside]1115-the whole watching nervous countryside . Going from whispering mouth to mouth , swift and certain over the length and breadth of [the country]1626-the country , passed the story of the murder of [Mr. Wicksteed]142-mr. wicksteed .

If [our]1117-we supposition that [[the Invisible Man]150-the invisible man s refuge]1119-the invisible man s refuge was [the Hintondean thickets]1120-the hintondean thickets , then [we]1117-we must suppose that in the early afternoon [he]150-the invisible man sallied out again bent upon some project that involved the use of a weapon . [We]1117-we can not know what the project was , but the evidence that [he]150-the invisible man had the iron rod in hand before [he]150-the invisible man met [Wicksteed]142-mr. wicksteed is to [me]0-disguised at least overwhelming .

Of course [we]1117-we can know nothing of the details of that encounter . It occurred on the edge of [a gravel pit]1121-a gravel pit , not two hundred yards from [[Lord Burdock]143-lord burdock s lodge gate]1122-lord burdock s lodge gate . Everything points to a desperate struggle the trampled ground , the numerous wounds [Mr. Wicksteed]142-mr. wicksteed received , [his]142-mr. wicksteed splintered walking - stick ; but why the attack was made , save in a murderous frenzy , it is impossible to imagine . Indeed the theory of madness is almost unavoidable . [Mr. Wicksteed]142-mr. wicksteed was [a man of forty - five or forty - six]1123-a man of forty - five or forty - six , steward to [Lord Burdock]143-lord burdock , of inoffensive habits and appearance , [the very last person in [the world]547-the world]1124-the very last person in the world to provoke such [a terrible antagonist]1126-a terrible antagonist . Against [him]142-mr. wicksteed it would seem [the Invisible Man]150-the invisible man used an iron rod dragged from a broken piece of fence . [He]142-mr. wicksteed stopped [this quiet man]1128-this quiet man , going quietly [home]1466-home to [his]142-mr. wicksteed midday meal , attacked [him]1128-this quiet man , beat down [his]1128-this quiet man feeble defences , broke [his]1128-this quiet man arm , felled [him]1128-this quiet man , and smashed [his]1128-this quiet man head to a jelly .

Of course , [he]142-mr. wicksteed must have dragged this rod out of the fencing before [he]142-mr. wicksteed met [[his]142-mr. wicksteed victim]1130-his victim [he]142-mr. wicksteed must have been carrying it ready in [his]142-mr. wicksteed hand . Only two details beyond what has already been stated seem to bear on the matter . One is the circumstance that [the gravel pit]1131-the gravel pit was not in [[Mr. Wicksteed]142-mr. wicksteed s direct path home]1132-mr. wicksteed s direct path home , but nearly a couple of hundred yards out of [his]142-mr. wicksteed way . The other is the assertion of [a little girl]1505-a little girl to the effect that , going to [[her]1505-a little girl afternoon school]1134-her afternoon school , [she]1505-a little girl saw [the murdered man]1135-the murdered man " trotting "[1135-the murdered man] in a peculiar manner across [a field]1136-a field towards [the gravel pit]1131-the gravel pit . [Her]1505-a little girl pantomime of [his]1135-the murdered man action suggests [a man]1463-a man pursuing something on the ground before [him]1135-the murdered man and striking at it ever and again with [his]1135-the murdered man walking - stick . [She]1505-a little girl was [the last person to see [him]1135-the murdered man alive]1139-the last person to see him alive . [He]1135-the murdered man passed out of [her]1505-a little girl sight to [his]1135-the murdered man death , the struggle being hidden from [her]1505-a little girl only by a clump of beech trees and a slight depression in the ground .

Now this , to the present writer s mind at least , lifts the murder out of the realm of [the absolutely wanton]1140-the absolutely wanton . [We]1141-we may imagine that [Griffin]131-griffin had taken the rod as a weapon indeed , but without any deliberate intention of using it in murder . [Wicksteed]142-mr. wicksteed may then have come by and noticed this rod inexplicably moving through the air . Without any thought of the Invisible Man for [Port Burdock]122-port burdock is ten miles away [he]142-mr. wicksteed may have pursued it . It is quite conceivable that [he]142-mr. wicksteed may not even have heard of [the Invisible Man]141-the invisible man . [One]214-one can then imagine [the Invisible Man]141-the invisible man making off quietly in order to avoid discovering [his]141-the invisible man presence in [the neighbourhood]1143-the neighbourhood , and [Wicksteed]141-the invisible man , excited and curious , pursuing this unaccountably locomotive object finally striking at it .

No doubt [the Invisible Man]141-the invisible man could easily have distanced [[his]141-the invisible man middle - aged pursuer]1144-his middle - aged pursuer under ordinary circumstances , but the position in which [Wicksteed]141-the invisible man s body was found suggests that [he]141-the invisible man had the ill luck to drive [his]141-the invisible man quarry into a corner between [a drift of stinging nettles]1145-a drift of stinging nettles and [the gravel pit]1131-the gravel pit . To [those who appreciate the extraordinary irascibility of the Invisible Man]1147-those who appreciate the extraordinary irascibility of the invisible man , the rest of the encounter will be easy to imagine .

But this is pure hypothesis . The only undeniable facts for stories of [children]265-children are often unreliable are the discovery of [Wicksteed]141-the invisible man s body , done to death , and of the blood - stained iron rod flung among the nettles . The abandonment of the rod by [Griffin]131-griffin , suggests that in the emotional excitement of the affair , the purpose for which [he]141-the invisible man took it if [he]141-the invisible man had a purpose was abandoned . [He]141-the invisible man was certainly [an intensely egotistical and unfeeling man]1149-an intensely egotistical and unfeeling man , but the sight of [[his]141-the invisible man victim]1130-his victim , [[his]141-the invisible man first victim]1151-his first victim , bloody and pitiful at [his]141-the invisible man feet , may have released some long pent fountain of remorse which for a time may have flooded whatever scheme of action [he]141-the invisible man had contrived .

After the murder of [Mr. Wicksteed]142-mr. wicksteed , [he]141-the invisible man would seem to have struck across [the country]1626-the country towards [the downland]1153-the downland . There is a story of a voice heard about sunset by [a couple of men in [a field near [Fern Bottom]64-fern bottom]1155-a field near fern bottom]1154-a couple of men in a field near fern bottom . [It]1156-it was wailing and laughing , sobbing and groaning , and ever and again it shouted . It must have been queer hearing . It drove up across the middle of [a clover field]1157-a clover field and died away towards [the hills]1158-the hills .

That afternoon [the Invisible Man]150-the invisible man must have learnt something of the rapid use [Kemp]121-kemp had made of [his]150-the invisible man confidences . [He]150-the invisible man must have found [houses]871-houses locked and secured ; [he]150-the invisible man may have loitered about [railway stations]1161-railway stations and prowled about [inns]828-inns , and no doubt [he]150-the invisible man read the proclamations and realised something of the nature of the campaign against [him]150-the invisible man . And as the evening advanced , [the fields]1163-the fields became dotted here and there with [groups of three or four men]1164-groups of three or four men , and noisy with the yelping of dogs . [These men - hunters]1165-these men - hunters had particular instructions in the case of an encounter as to the way [they]1165-these men - hunters should support [one another]213-one another . But [he]150-the invisible man avoided [them]1165-these men - hunters all . [We]1167-we may understand something of [his]150-the invisible man exasperation , and it could have been none the less because [he]150-the invisible man [himself]150-the invisible man had supplied the information that was being used so remorselessly against [him]150-the invisible man . For that day at least [he]150-the invisible man lost heart ; for nearly twenty - four hours , save when [he]150-the invisible man turned on [Wicksteed]142-mr. wicksteed , [he]150-the invisible man was [a hunted man]1168-a hunted man . In the night , [he]150-the invisible man must have eaten and slept ; for in the morning [he]150-the invisible man was [himself]150-the invisible man again , active , powerful , angry , and malignant , prepared for [his]150-the invisible man last great struggle against [the world]547-the world .

CHAPTER XXVII . THE SIEGE OF [KEMP]121-kemp S HOUSE

[Kemp]121-kemp read a strange missive , written in pencil on a greasy sheet of paper .

" [You]121-kemp have been amazingly energetic and clever , "[150-the invisible man] this letter ran , " though what [you]121-kemp stand to gain by it [I]150-the invisible man can not imagine . [You]121-kemp are against [me]150-the invisible man . For a whole day [you]121-kemp have chased [me]150-the invisible man ; [you]121-kemp have tried to rob [me]150-the invisible man of a night s rest . But [I]150-the invisible man have had food in spite of [you]121-kemp , [I]150-the invisible man have slept in spite of [you]121-kemp , and the game is only beginning . The game is only beginning . There is nothing for it , but to start the Terror . This announces the first day of the Terror . [Port Burdock]122-port burdock is no longer under [the Queen]2303-the queen , tell [[your]121-kemp Colonel of Police]2304-your colonel of police , and [the rest of [them]2304-your colonel of police]2305-the rest of them ; it is under [me]150-the invisible man the Terror ! This is day one of year one of the new epoch the Epoch of [the Invisible Man]150-the invisible man . [I]150-the invisible man am [Invisible Man]1591-invisible man the First . To begin with the rule will be easy . The first day there will be one execution for the sake of example [a man named [Kemp]121-kemp]2308-a man named kemp . [Death]144-death starts for [him]121-kemp to - day . [He]121-kemp may lock [himself]121-kemp away , hide [himself]121-kemp away , get [guards]2309-guards about [him]121-kemp , put on armour if [he]121-kemp likes [Death]144-death , [the unseen Death]2310-the unseen death , is coming . Let [him]121-kemp take precautions ; it will impress [[my]150-the invisible man people]2311-my people . [Death]144-death starts from the pillar box by midday . The letter will fall in as [the postman]204-the postman comes along , then off ! The game begins . [Death]144-death starts . Help [him]121-kemp not , [[my]150-the invisible man people]2311-my people , lest [Death]144-death fall upon [you]2311-my people also . To - day [Kemp]121-kemp is to die . "[150-the invisible man]

[Kemp]121-kemp read this letter twice , " It s no hoax , "[121-kemp] [he]121-kemp said . " That s [his]121-kemp voice ! And [he]121-kemp means it . "[121-kemp]

[He]121-kemp turned the folded sheet over and saw on the addressed side of it the postmark Hintondean , and the prosaic detail " 2d . to pay . "[121-kemp]

[He]121-kemp got up slowly , leaving [his]121-kemp lunch unfinished the letter had come by the one o clock post and went into [[his]121-kemp study]836-his study . [He]121-kemp rang for [[his]121-kemp housekeeper]1171-his housekeeper , and told [her]1171-his housekeeper to go round [the house]396-the house at once , examine all the fastenings of the windows , and close all the shutters . [He]121-kemp closed the shutters of [[his]121-kemp study]836-his study [himself]121-kemp . From a locked drawer in [[his]121-kemp bedroom]253-his bedroom [he]121-kemp took a little revolver , examined it carefully , and put it into the pocket of [his]121-kemp lounge jacket . [He]121-kemp wrote a number of brief notes , one to [Colonel Adye]133-adye , gave them to [[his]121-kemp servant]1175-his servant to take , with explicit instructions as to [her]1175-his servant way of leaving [the house]396-the house . " There is no danger , "[121-kemp] [he]121-kemp said , and added a mental reservation , " to [you]1175-his servant . "[121-kemp] [He]121-kemp remained meditative for a space after doing this , and then returned to [his]121-kemp cooling lunch .

[He]121-kemp ate with gaps of thought . Finally [he]121-kemp struck the table sharply . " [We]2314-we will have [him]121-kemp ! "[121-kemp] [he]121-kemp said ; " and [I]121-kemp am [the bait]2315-the bait . [He]121-kemp will come too far . "[121-kemp]

[He]121-kemp went up to [the belvedere]1034-the belvedere , carefully shutting every door after [him]121-kemp . " It s a game , "[121-kemp] [he]121-kemp said , " an odd game but the chances are all for [me]121-kemp , [Mr. Griffin]131-griffin , in spite of [your]131-griffin invisibility . [Griffin]131-griffin _ contra mundum _ ... with a vengeance . "[121-kemp]

[He]121-kemp stood at the window staring at [the hot hillside]1178-the hot hillside . " [He]121-kemp must get food every day and [I]121-kemp don t envy [him]121-kemp . Did [he]121-kemp really sleep last night ? Out in the open somewhere secure from collisions . [I]121-kemp wish [we]2316-we could get some good cold wet weather instead of the heat . "[121-kemp]

" [He]121-kemp may be watching [me]121-kemp now . "[121-kemp]

[He]121-kemp went close to the window . Something rapped smartly against the brickwork over the frame , and made [him]121-kemp start violently back .

" [I]121-kemp m getting nervous , "[121-kemp] said [Kemp]121-kemp . But it was five minutes before [he]121-kemp went to the window again . " It must have been a sparrow , "[121-kemp] [he]121-kemp said .

Presently [he]121-kemp heard the front - door bell ringing , and hurried [downstairs]377-downstairs . [He]121-kemp unbolted and unlocked the door , examined the chain , put it up , and opened cautiously without showing [himself]121-kemp . [A familiar voice]1180-a familiar voice hailed [him]121-kemp . [Kemp]121-kemp released the chain , and [Adye]133-adye entered through as narrow an opening as possible . " [You]133-adye must step straight out , "[121-kemp] said [Kemp]121-kemp . In another moment [Adye]133-adye was on [the doorstep]1197-the doorstep and the bolts were dropping back into the staples . [He]133-adye crossed [the lawn]1198-the lawn and approached the gate . A little breeze seemed to ripple over the grass . Something moved near [him]133-adye . " Stop a bit , "[815-a voice] said [a Voice]815-a voice , and [Adye]133-adye stopped dead and [his]133-adye hand tightened on the revolver .

" Well ? "[133-adye] said [Adye]133-adye , white and grim , and every nerve tense .

" Oblige [me]601-the voice by going back to [the house]396-the house , "[601-the voice] said [the Voice]601-the voice , as tense and grim as [Adye]133-adye s.

" Sorry , "[133-adye] said [Adye]133-adye a little hoarsely , and moistened [his]133-adye lips with [his]133-adye tongue . [The Voice]601-the voice was on [his]133-adye left front , [he]133-adye thought . Suppose [he]133-adye were to take [his]133-adye luck with a shot ?

" What are [you]133-adye going for ? "[601-the voice] said [the Voice]601-the voice , and there was a quick movement of [the two]733-the two , and a flash of sunlight from the open lip of [Adye]133-adye s pocket .

[Adye]133-adye desisted and thought . " Where [I]133-adye go , "[133-adye] [he]133-adye said slowly , " is [my]133-adye own business . "[133-adye] The words were still on [his]133-adye lips , when an arm came round [his]133-adye neck , [his]133-adye back felt a knee , and [he]133-adye was sprawling backward . [He]133-adye drew clumsily and fired absurdly , and in another moment [he]133-adye was struck in the mouth and the revolver wrested from [his]133-adye grip . [He]133-adye made a vain clutch at a slippery limb , tried to struggle up and fell back . " Damn ! "[133-adye] said [Adye]133-adye . [The Voice]108-the voice laughed . " [I]108-the voice d kill [you]133-adye now if it wasn t the waste of a bullet , "[108-the voice] it said . [He]133-adye saw the revolver in mid - air , six feet off , covering [him]133-adye .

" Well ? "[133-adye] said [Adye]133-adye , sitting up .

" Get up , "[601-the voice] said [the Voice]601-the voice .

[Adye]133-adye stood up .

" Attention , "[601-the voice] said [the Voice]601-the voice , and then fiercely , " Don t try any games . Remember [I]601-the voice can see [your]133-adye face if [you]133-adye can t see [mine]601-the voice . [You]133-adye ve got to go back to [the house]396-the house . "[601-the voice]

" [He]150-the invisible man won t let [me]133-adye in , "[133-adye] said [Adye]133-adye .

" That s a pity , "[150-the invisible man] said [the Invisible Man]150-the invisible man . " [I]150-the invisible man ve got no quarrel with [you]133-adye . "[150-the invisible man]

[Adye]133-adye moistened [his]133-adye lips again . [He]133-adye glanced away from the barrel of the revolver and saw [the sea]1703-the sea far off very blue and dark under the midday sun , the smooth green down , [the white cliff of [the Head]66-the head]1208-the white cliff of the head , and [the multitudinous town]1209-the multitudinous town , and suddenly [he]133-adye knew that life was very sweet . "[133-adye] [he]133-adye said sullenly .

" [I]601-the voice ve got no quarrel with [you]121-kemp , "[601-the voice] said [the Voice]601-the voice .

[Kemp]121-kemp had hurried [upstairs]256-upstairs after letting [Adye]133-adye out , and now crouching among the broken glass and peering cautiously over the edge of the study window sill , [he]121-kemp saw [Adye]133-adye stand parleying with [the Unseen]996-the unseen . [He]121-kemp shaded [his]121-kemp eyes and tried to see the source of the blinding beam .

" [You]121-kemp go back to [the house]396-the house . [I]133-adye tell [you]121-kemp flatly [I]133-adye will not promise anything . "[133-adye]

[Adye]133-adye s decision seemed suddenly made . [He]133-adye turned towards [the house]396-the house , walking slowly with [his]133-adye hands behind [him]133-adye . [Kemp]121-kemp watched [him]133-adye puzzled . The revolver vanished , flashed again into sight , vanished again , and became evident on a closer scrutiny as a little dark object following [Adye]133-adye . Then things happened very quickly . [Adye]133-adye leapt backwards , swung around , clutched at this little object , missed it , threw up [his]133-adye hands and fell forward on [his]133-adye face , leaving a little puff of blue in the air . [Kemp]121-kemp did not hear the sound of the shot . [Adye]133-adye writhed , raised [himself]133-adye on one arm , fell forward , and lay still .

For a space [Kemp]121-kemp remained staring at the quiet carelessness of [Adye]133-adye s attitude . The afternoon was very hot and still , nothing seemed stirring in all [the world]547-the world save a couple of yellow butterflies chasing each other through the shrubbery between [the house]396-the house and [the road]262-the road gate . [Adye]133-adye lay on the lawn near the gate . The blinds of [all the villas down [the hill - road]1219-the hill - road]1218-all the villas down the hill - road were drawn , but in [one little green summer - house]1220-one little green summer - house was a white figure , apparently [an old man asleep]1221-an old man asleep . [Kemp]121-kemp scrutinised the surroundings of [the house]396-the house for a glimpse of the revolver , but it had vanished . [His]121-kemp eyes came back to [Adye]133-adye . The game was opening well .

Then came a ringing and knocking at the front door , that grew at last tumultuous , but pursuant to [Kemp]121-kemp s instructions [the servants]1223-the servants had locked [themselves]1223-the servants into [[their]1223-the servants rooms]1224-their rooms . This was followed by a silence . [Kemp]121-kemp sat listening and then began peering cautiously out of the three windows , one after another . [He]121-kemp went to the staircase head and stood listening uneasily . [He]121-kemp armed [himself]121-kemp with [[his]121-kemp bedroom]253-his bedroom poker , and went to examine the interior fastenings of the ground - floor windows again . Everything was safe and quiet . [He]121-kemp returned to [the belvedere]1034-the belvedere . [Adye]133-adye lay motionless over the edge of the gravel just as [he]133-adye had fallen . Coming along [the road]262-the road by [the villas]1228-the villas were [the housemaid]963-the housemaid and [two policemen]1230-two policemen .

Everything was deadly still . [The three people]1231-the three people seemed very slow in approaching . [He]121-kemp wondered what [[his]121-kemp antagonist]1232-his antagonist was doing .

[He]121-kemp started . There was a smash from below . [He]121-kemp hesitated and went [downstairs]377-downstairs again . Suddenly [the house]396-the house resounded with heavy blows and the splintering of wood . [He]121-kemp heard a smash and the destructive clang of the iron fastenings of the shutters . [He]121-kemp turned the key and opened the kitchen door . As [he]121-kemp did so , the shutters , split and splintering , came flying inward . [He]121-kemp stood aghast . The window frame , save for one crossbar , was still intact , but only little teeth of glass remained in the frame . The shutters had been driven in with an axe , and now the axe was descending in sweeping blows upon the window frame and the iron bars defending it . Then suddenly it leapt aside and vanished . [He]121-kemp saw the revolver lying on the path outside , and then the little weapon sprang into the air . [He]121-kemp dodged back . The revolver cracked just too late , and a splinter from the edge of the closing door flashed over [his]121-kemp head . [He]121-kemp slammed and locked the door , and as [he]121-kemp stood outside [he]121-kemp heard [Griffin]131-griffin shouting and laughing . Then the blows of the axe with its splitting and smashing consequences , were resumed .

[Kemp]121-kemp stood in [the passage]252-the passage trying to think . In a moment [the Invisible Man]150-the invisible man would be in [the kitchen]1419-the kitchen . This door would not keep [him]121-kemp a moment , and then

A ringing came at the front door again . It would be [the policemen]1238-the policemen . [He]121-kemp ran into [the hall]346-the hall , put up the chain , and drew the bolts . [He]121-kemp made [the girl]1523-the girl speak before [he]121-kemp dropped the chain , and [the three people]1231-the three people blundered into [the house]396-the house in a heap , and [Kemp]121-kemp slammed the door again .

" [The Invisible Man]150-the invisible man ! "[121-kemp] said [Kemp]121-kemp . " [He]150-the invisible man has a revolver , with two shots left . [He]150-the invisible man s killed [Adye]133-adye . [The second policeman]1256-the second policeman brought [his]1256-the second policeman poker down on the little weapon , as one might knock down a wasp , and sent it rattling to the floor .

At the first clash [the girl]1523-the girl screamed , stood screaming for a moment by the fireplace , and then ran to open the shutters possibly with an idea of escaping by the shattered window .

Then , as [the policeman]884-the policeman staggered with the swing of the blow [he]1259-the first policeman had aimed , [the Invisible Man]150-the invisible man countered with the axe , the helmet crumpled like paper , and the blow sent [the man]345-the man spinning to the floor at the head of [the kitchen stairs]1265-the kitchen stairs . But [the second policeman]1256-the second policeman , aiming behind the axe with [his]1256-the second policeman poker , hit something soft that snapped . There was a sharp exclamation of pain and then the axe fell to the ground . [The policeman]884-the policeman wiped again at vacancy and hit nothing ; [he]884-the policeman put [his]884-the policeman foot on the axe , and struck again . Then [he]884-the policeman stood , poker clubbed , listening intent for the slightest movement .

[He]884-the policeman heard the dining - room window open , and a quick rush of feet within . [[His]884-the policeman companion]1268-his companion rolled over and sat up , with the blood running down between [his]1268-his companion eye and ear . " Where is [he]345-the man ? " [Doctor Kemp]146-kemp , "[884-the policeman] cried [the policeman]884-the policeman again .
