" [Doctor Kemp]146-kemp "[1259-the first policeman] [he]1259-the first policeman began , and stopped short .

" [Doctor Kemp]146-kemp s [a hero]2343-a hero , "[1259-the first policeman] [he]1259-the first policeman said , as [[his]1259-the first policeman companion]1268-his companion looked over [his]1259-the first policeman shoulder .

[The dining - room]968-the dining - room window was wide open , and [neither housemaid]1279-neither housemaid nor [Kemp]146-kemp was to be seen .

[The second policeman]1256-the second policeman s opinion of [Kemp]146-kemp was terse and vivid .

CHAPTER XXVIII . [THE HUNTER HUNTED

Mr. Heelas]147-mr. heelas , [Mr. Kemp]148-mr. kemp [s nearest neighbour among [the villa holders]1282-the villa holders]1281-s nearest neighbour among the villa holders , was asleep in [[his]1281-s nearest neighbour among the villa holders summer house]1283-his summer house when the siege of [[Kemp]146-kemp s house]1077-kemp s house began . [Mr. Heelas]147-mr. heelas was [one of [the sturdy minority who refused to believe " in all this nonsense "[147-mr. heelas] about [an Invisible Man]1549-an invisible man]1286-the sturdy minority who refused to believe " in all this nonsense " about an invisible man . [[His]147-mr. heelas wife]226-his wife , however , as [he]147-mr. heelas was subsequently to be reminded]1285-one of the sturdy minority who refused to believe " in all this nonsense " about an invisible man . his wife , however , as he was subsequently to be reminded , did . [He]147-mr. heelas insisted upon walking about [[his]147-mr. heelas garden]1289-his garden just as if nothing was the matter , and [he]147-mr. heelas went to sleep in the afternoon in accordance with the custom of years . [He]147-mr. heelas slept through the smashing of the windows , and then woke up suddenly with a curious persuasion of something wrong . [He]147-mr. heelas looked across at [[Kemp]146-kemp s house]1077-kemp s house , rubbed [his]147-mr. heelas eyes and looked again . Then [he]147-mr. heelas put [his]147-mr. heelas feet to the ground , and sat listening . [He]147-mr. heelas said [he]147-mr. heelas was damned , but still the strange thing was visible . [The house]396-the house looked as though [it]396-the house had been deserted for weeks after a violent riot . Every window was broken , and every window , save those of [the belvedere study]1024-the belvedere study , was blinded by the internal shutters .

" [I]147-mr. heelas could have sworn it was all right "[147-mr. heelas] [he]147-mr. heelas looked at [his]147-mr. heelas watch " twenty minutes ago . "[147-mr. heelas]

[He]147-mr. heelas became aware of a measured concussion and the clash of glass , far away in the distance . And then , as [he]147-mr. heelas sat open - mouthed , came a still more wonderful thing . The shutters of the drawing - room window were flung open violently , and [the housemaid]963-the housemaid in [her]963-the housemaid outdoor hat and garments , appeared struggling in a frantic manner to throw up the sash . Suddenly [a man]1463-a man appeared beside [her]963-the housemaid , helping [her]963-the housemaid [Dr. Kemp]121-kemp ! In another moment the window was open , and [the housemaid]963-the housemaid was struggling out ; [she]963-the housemaid pitched forward and vanished among the shrubs . [Mr. Heelas]147-mr. heelas stood up , exclaiming vaguely and vehemently at all these wonderful things . [He]147-mr. heelas saw [Kemp]121-kemp stand on the sill , spring from the window , and reappear almost instantaneously running along a path in the shrubbery and stooping as [he]121-kemp ran , like [a man who evades observation]1296-a man who evades observation . [He]121-kemp vanished behind [a laburnum]1297-a laburnum , and appeared again clambering over a fence that abutted on the open down . In a second [he]121-kemp had tumbled over and was running at a tremendous pace down the slope towards [Mr. Heelas]147-mr. heelas .

" [Lord]2344-lord ! "[147-mr. heelas] cried [Mr. Heelas]147-mr. heelas , struck with an idea ; " it s that [Invisible Man]141-the invisible man brute ! It s right , after all ! "[147-mr. heelas]

With [Mr. Heelas]147-mr. heelas to think things like that was to act , and [[his]147-mr. heelas cook]1298-his cook watching [him]147-mr. heelas from the top window was amazed to see [him]121-kemp come pelting towards [the house]396-the house at a good nine miles an hour . There was a slamming of doors , a ringing of bells , and the voice of [Mr. Heelas]147-mr. heelas bellowing like a bull . " Shut the doors , shut the windows , shut everything ! [the Invisible Man]150-the invisible man is coming ! "[147-mr. heelas] Instantly [the house]396-the house was full of screams and directions , and scurrying feet . [He]147-mr. heelas ran [himself]147-mr. heelas to shut the French windows that opened on [the veranda]1301-the veranda ; as [he]147-mr. heelas did so [Kemp]121-kemp s head and shoulders and knee appeared over the edge of the garden fence . In another moment [Kemp]121-kemp had ploughed through the asparagus , and was running across [the tennis lawn]1302-the tennis lawn to [the house]396-the house .

" [You]121-kemp can t come in , "[147-mr. heelas] said [Mr. Heelas]147-mr. heelas , shutting the bolts . " [I]147-mr. heelas m very sorry if [he]121-kemp s after [you]121-kemp , but [you]121-kemp can t come in ! "[147-mr. heelas]

[Kemp]121-kemp appeared with a face of terror close to the glass , rapping and then shaking frantically at the French window . Then , seeing [his]121-kemp efforts were useless , [he]121-kemp ran along [the veranda]1301-the veranda , vaulted the end , and went to hammer at the side door . Then [he]121-kemp ran round by the side gate to the front of [the house]396-the house , and so into [the hill - road]1219-the hill - road . And [Mr. Heelas]147-mr. heelas staring from [his]147-mr. heelas window a face of horror had scarcely witnessed [Kemp]121-kemp vanish , ere the asparagus was being trampled this way and that by feet unseen . At that [Mr. Heelas]147-mr. heelas fled precipitately [upstairs]256-upstairs , and the rest of the chase is beyond [his]147-mr. heelas purview . But as [he]147-mr. heelas passed the staircase window , [he]147-mr. heelas heard the side gate slam .

Emerging into [the hill - road]1219-the hill - road , [Kemp]121-kemp naturally took the downward direction , and so it was [he]121-kemp came to run in [his]121-kemp own person the very race [he]121-kemp had watched with such a critical eye from the belvedere study only four days ago . [He]121-kemp ran it well , for [a man out of training]1309-a man out of training , and though [his]121-kemp face was white and wet , [his]121-kemp wits were cool to the last . [He]121-kemp ran with wide strides , and wherever a patch of rough ground intervened , wherever there came a patch of raw flints , or a bit of broken glass shone dazzling , [he]121-kemp crossed it and left the bare invisible feet that followed to take what line [they]1310-they would .

For the first time in [his]121-kemp life [Kemp]121-kemp discovered that [the hill - road]1219-the hill - road was indescribably vast and desolate , and that [the beginnings of [the town far below]1313-the town far below at [the hill foot]1314-the hill foot]1312-the beginnings of the town far below at the hill foot were strangely remote . Never had there been a slower or more painful method of progression than running . [All the gaunt villas , sleeping in the afternoon sun]1315-all the gaunt villas , sleeping in the afternoon sun , looked locked and barred ; no doubt [they]1315-all the gaunt villas , sleeping in the afternoon sun were locked and barred by [his]121-kemp own orders . But at any rate [they]1315-all the gaunt villas , sleeping in the afternoon sun might have kept a lookout for an eventuality like this ! [The town]872-the town was rising up now , [the sea]1703-the sea had dropped out of sight behind [it]872-the town , and [people down below]1318-people down below were stirring . [A tram]1319-a tram was just arriving at the hill foot . Beyond that was [the police station]1320-the police station . Was that footsteps [he]121-kemp heard behind [him]121-kemp ? Spurt .

[The people below]1321-the people below were staring at [him]121-kemp , [one or two]1322-one or two were running , and [his]121-kemp breath was beginning to saw in [his]121-kemp throat . [The tram]1323-the tram was quite near now , and [the " Jolly Cricketers]2346-the " jolly cricketers "[2346-the " jolly cricketers] was noisily barring its doors . Beyond the tram were posts and heaps of gravel [the drainage works]1324-the drainage works . [He]121-kemp had a transitory idea of jumping into [the tram]1323-the tram and slamming the doors , and then [he]121-kemp resolved to go for [the police station]1320-the police station . In another moment [he]121-kemp had passed the door of the " Jolly Cricketers , "[121-kemp] and was in the blistering fag end of [the street]439-the street , with human beings about [him]121-kemp . [The tram driver]1328-the tram driver and [[his]1328-the tram driver helper]1329-his helper arrested by the sight of [his]1328-the tram driver furious haste stood staring with the tram horses unhitched . Further on the astonished features of navvies appeared above the mounds of gravel .

[His]121-kemp pace broke a little , and then [he]121-kemp heard the swift pad of [[his]121-kemp pursuer]1330-his pursuer , and leapt forward again . " [The Invisible Man]150-the invisible man ! "[121-kemp] [he]121-kemp cried to [the navvies]1331-the navvies , with a vague indicative gesture , and by an inspiration leapt the excavation and placed [a burly group]1332-a burly group between [him]121-kemp and the chase . Then abandoning the idea of [the police station]1320-the police station [he]121-kemp turned into [a little side street]1334-a little side street , rushed by a greengrocer s cart , hesitated for the tenth of a second at the door of [a sweetstuff shop]1335-a sweetstuff shop , and then made for the mouth of an alley that ran back into [the main Hill Street]1336-the main hill street again . [Two or three little children]1337-two or three little children were playing [here]1660-here , and shrieked and scattered at [his]121-kemp apparition , and forthwith doors and windows opened and [excited mothers]1339-excited mothers revealed [their]1339-excited mothers hearts . Out [he]121-kemp shot into [Hill Street]67-hill street again , three hundred yards from the tram - line end , and immediately [he]121-kemp became aware of [a tumultuous vociferation and running people]1340-a tumultuous vociferation and running people .

[He]121-kemp glanced up [the street]439-the street towards [the hill]592-the hill . Hardly a dozen yards off ran [a huge navvy , cursing in fragments and slashing viciously with a spade]1343-a huge navvy , cursing in fragments and slashing viciously with a spade , and hard behind [him]121-kemp came [the tram conductor]1344-the tram conductor with [his]1344-the tram conductor fists clenched . Up [the street]439-the street [others]295-others followed [these two]1347-these two , striking and shouting . Down towards [the town]872-the town , [men]572-men and [women]1471-women were running , and [he]121-kemp noticed clearly [one man]2112-one man coming out of [a shop]1905-a shop - door with a stick in [his]2112-one man hand . " Spread out ! Spread out ! "[501-some one] cried [some one]501-some one . [Kemp]121-kemp suddenly grasped the altered condition of the chase . [He]121-kemp stopped , and looked round , panting . " [He]2112-one man s close here ! "[121-kemp] [he]121-kemp cried . " Form a line across "[121-kemp]

[He]121-kemp was hit hard under the ear , and went reeling , trying to face round towards [[his]121-kemp unseen antagonist]1354-his unseen antagonist . [He]121-kemp just managed to keep [his]121-kemp feet , and [he]121-kemp struck a vain counter in the air . Then [he]121-kemp was hit again under the jaw , and sprawled headlong on the ground . In another moment a knee compressed [his]121-kemp diaphragm , and a couple of eager hands gripped [his]121-kemp throat , but the grip of one was weaker than the other ; [he]121-kemp grasped the wrists , heard a cry of pain from [[his]121-kemp assailant]1355-his assailant , and then the spade of [the navvy]1356-the navvy came whirling through the air above [him]121-kemp , and struck something with a dull thud . [He]121-kemp felt a drop of moisture on [his]121-kemp face . The grip at [his]121-kemp throat suddenly relaxed , and with a convulsive effort , [Kemp]121-kemp loosed [himself]121-kemp , grasped a limp shoulder , and rolled uppermost . [He]121-kemp gripped the unseen elbows near the ground . " [I]121-kemp ve got [him]150-the invisible man ! "[121-kemp] screamed [Kemp]121-kemp . " Help ! Help hold ! [He]150-the invisible man s down ! Hold [his]150-the invisible man feet ! "[121-kemp]

In another second there was a simultaneous rush upon the struggle , and [a stranger coming into the road]1357-a stranger coming into the road suddenly might have thought an exceptionally savage game of Rugby football was in progress . And there was no shouting after [Kemp]121-kemp s cry only a sound of blows and feet and heavy breathing .

Then came a mighty effort , and [the Invisible Man]150-the invisible man threw off a couple of [[his]150-the invisible man antagonists]1359-his antagonists and rose to [his]150-the invisible man knees . [Kemp]121-kemp clung to [him]150-the invisible man in front like a hound to a stag , and a dozen hands gripped , clutched , and tore at [the Unseen]996-the unseen . [The tram conductor]1344-the tram conductor suddenly got the neck and shoulders and lugged [him]121-kemp back .

Down went the heap of [struggling men]1362-struggling men again and rolled over . There was , [I]0-disguised am afraid , some savage kicking . Then suddenly a wild scream of " Mercy ! Mercy ! "[688-the doctor] that died down swiftly to a sound like choking .

" Get back , [[you]2348-you fools]2349-you fools ! "[121-kemp] cried the muffled voice of [Kemp]121-kemp , and there was a vigorous shoving back of stalwart forms . " [He]121-kemp s hurt , [I]121-kemp tell [you]2348-you . Stand back ! "[121-kemp]

There was a brief struggle to clear a space , and then [the circle of eager faces]1363-the circle of eager faces saw [the doctor]688-the doctor kneeling , as it seemed , fifteen inches in the air , and holding invisible arms to the ground . Behind [him]688-the doctor [a constable]1365-a constable gripped invisible ankles .

" Don t [you]2348-you leave go of en , "[1366-the big navvy] cried [the big navvy]1366-the big navvy , holding a blood - stained spade ; " [he]121-kemp s shamming . "[1366-the big navvy]

" [He]121-kemp s not shamming , "[688-the doctor] said [the doctor]688-the doctor , cautiously raising [his]688-the doctor knee ; " and [I]688-the doctor ll hold [him]121-kemp . "[688-the doctor] [His]688-the doctor face was bruised and already going red ; [he]688-the doctor spoke thickly because of a bleeding lip . [He]688-the doctor released one hand and seemed to be feeling at the face . " The mouth s all wet , "[688-the doctor] [he]688-the doctor said . And then , " [Good God]132-great god ! "[688-the doctor]

[He]688-the doctor stood up abruptly and then knelt down on the ground by the side of the thing unseen . There was a pushing and shuffling , a sound of heavy feet as [fresh people]1368-fresh people turned up to increase the pressure of [the crowd]529-the crowd . [People]330-people now were coming out of [the houses]2285-the houses . The doors of the " Jolly Cricketers "[1372-an old woman] stood suddenly wide open . Very little was said .

[Kemp]121-kemp felt about , [his]121-kemp hand seeming to pass through empty air . " [He]121-kemp s not breathing , "[688-the doctor] [he]688-the doctor said , and then , " [I]688-the doctor can t feel [his]121-kemp heart . [His]121-kemp side ugh ! "[688-the doctor]

Suddenly [an old woman]1372-an old woman , peering under the arm of [the big navvy]1366-the big navvy , screamed sharply . " Looky there ! "[1372-an old woman] [she]1372-an old woman said , and thrust out a wrinkled finger .

And looking where [she]1372-an old woman pointed , [everyone]249-everyone saw , faint and transparent as though it was made of glass , so that veins and arteries and bones and nerves could be distinguished , the outline of a hand , a hand limp and prone . It grew clouded and opaque even as [they]249-everyone stared .

" Hullo ! "[1375-the constable] cried [the constable]1375-the constable . " Here s [his]121-kemp feet a - showing ! "[1375-the constable]

And so , slowly , beginning at [his]688-the doctor hands and feet and creeping along [his]688-the doctor limbs to the vital centres of [his]688-the doctor body , that strange change continued . It was like the slow spreading of a poison . First came the little white nerves , a hazy grey sketch of a limb , then the glassy bones and intricate arteries , then the flesh and skin , first a faint fogginess , and then growing rapidly dense and opaque . Presently [they]249-everyone could see [his]688-the doctor crushed chest and [his]688-the doctor shoulders , and the dim outline of [his]688-the doctor drawn and battered features .

When at last [the crowd]529-the crowd made way for [Kemp]121-kemp to stand erect , there lay , naked and pitiful on the ground , the bruised and broken body of [a young man about thirty]1377-a young man about thirty . [His]688-the doctor hair and brow were white not grey with age , but white with the whiteness of albinism and [his]688-the doctor eyes were like garnets . [His]688-the doctor hands were clenched , [his]688-the doctor eyes wide open , and [his]688-the doctor expression was one of anger and dismay .

" Cover [his]688-the doctor face ! "[1463-a man] said [a man]1463-a man . " For Gawd s sake , cover that face ! "[1463-a man] and [three little children]1379-three little children , pushing forward through [the crowd]529-the crowd , were suddenly twisted round and sent packing off again .

[Someone]428-someone brought a sheet from the " Jolly Cricketers , "[249-everyone] and having covered [him]688-the doctor , [they]249-everyone carried [him]688-the doctor into [that house]2171-that house . And there it was , on a shabby bed in [a tawdry , ill - lighted bedroom]1383-a tawdry , ill - lighted bedroom , surrounded by a crowd of [ignorant and excited people]1384-ignorant and excited people , broken and wounded , betrayed and unpitied , that [Griffin]131-griffin , [the first of [all men]983-all men to make [himself]131-griffin invisible , [Griffin]131-griffin , [the most gifted physicist [the world]547-the world has ever seen]1387-the most gifted physicist the world has ever seen , ended in infinite disaster [his]131-griffin strange and terrible career]1385-the first of all men to make himself invisible , griffin , the most gifted physicist the world has ever seen , ended in infinite disaster his strange and terrible career .

THE EPILOGUE

So ends the story of the strange and evil experiments of [the Invisible Man]141-the invisible man . And if [you]1389-you would learn more of [him]141-the invisible man [you]1389-you must go to [a little inn near [Port Stowe]16-port stowe]1390-a little inn near port stowe and talk to [the landlord]1853-the landlord . The sign of [the inn]157-the inn is an empty board save for a hat and boots , and the name is the title of this story . [The landlord]1853-the landlord is [a short and corpulent little man with a nose of cylindrical proportions , wiry hair , and a sporadic rosiness of visage]1394-a short and corpulent little man with a nose of cylindrical proportions , wiry hair , and a sporadic rosiness of visage . Drink generously , and [he]1853-the landlord will tell [you]1389-you generously of all the things that happened to [him]1853-the landlord after that time , and of how [the lawyers]1395-the lawyers tried to do [him]1853-the landlord out of the treasure found upon [him]1853-the landlord .

" When [they]1395-the lawyers found [they]1395-the lawyers couldn t prove whose money was which , [I]1853-the landlord m blessed , "[1853-the landlord] [he]1853-the landlord says , " if [they]1395-the lawyers didn t try to make [me]1853-the landlord out a blooming treasure trove ! Do [I]1853-the landlord _ look _ like a Treasure Trove ? And then [a gentleman]1435-a gentleman gave [me]1853-the landlord a guinea a night to tell the story at [the Empire Music]68-the empire music All just to tell [em]1853-the landlord in [my]1853-the landlord own words barring one . "[1853-the landlord]

And if [you]1389-you want to cut off the flow of [his]1853-the landlord reminiscences abruptly , [you]1389-you can always do so by asking if there weren t three manuscript books in the story . [He]1853-the landlord admits there were and proceeds to explain , with asseverations that [everybody]1515-everybody thinks _ [he]1853-the landlord _ has em ! But bless [you]1389-you ! [he]1853-the landlord hasn t. " The Invisible Man it was took [em]1853-the landlord off to hide [em]1853-the landlord when [I]1853-the landlord cut and ran for [Port Stowe]16-port stowe . It s that [Mr. Kemp]148-mr. kemp put [people]330-people on with the idea of _ [my]1853-the landlord _ having [em]1853-the landlord . "[1853-the landlord]

And then [he]1853-the landlord subsides into a pensive state , watches [you]1389-you furtively , bustles nervously with glasses , and presently leaves [the bar]154-the bar .

[He]1853-the landlord is [a bachelor man [his]1853-the landlord tastes were ever bachelor]1398-a bachelor man his tastes were ever bachelor , and there are [no women folk]1399-no women folk in [the house]396-the house . Outwardly [he]1853-the landlord buttons it is expected of [him]1853-the landlord but in [his]1853-the landlord more vital privacies , in the matter of braces for example , [he]1853-the landlord still turns to string . [He]1853-the landlord conducts [[his]1853-the landlord house]1401-his house without enterprise , but with eminent decorum . [His]1853-the landlord movements are slow , and [he]1853-the landlord is [a great thinker]1402-a great thinker . But [he]1853-the landlord has a reputation for wisdom and for a respectable parsimony in [the village]216-the village , and [his]1853-the landlord knowledge of [the roads of [the South of]1405-the south of [England]50-england]1404-the roads of the south of england would beat [Cobbett]149-cobbett .

And on Sunday mornings , every Sunday morning , all the year round , while [he]1853-the landlord is closed to [the outer world]1406-the outer world , and every night after ten , [he]1853-the landlord goes into [[his]1853-the landlord bar parlour]1407-his bar parlour , bearing a glass of gin faintly tinged with water , and having placed this down , [he]1853-the landlord locks the door and examines the blinds , and even looks under the table . And then , being satisfied of [his]1853-the landlord solitude , [he]1853-the landlord unlocks the cupboard and a box in the cupboard and a drawer in that box , and produces three volumes bound in brown leather , and places them solemnly in the middle of the table . The covers are weather - worn and tinged with an algal green for once they sojourned in [a ditch]1408-a ditch and some of the pages have been washed blank by dirty water . [The landlord]1853-the landlord sits down in an armchair , fills a long clay pipe slowly gloating over the books the while . Then [he]1853-the landlord pulls one towards [him]1853-the landlord and opens it , and begins to study it turning over the leaves backwards and forwards .

[His]1853-the landlord brows are knit and [his]1853-the landlord lips move painfully . " Hex , little two up in the air , cross and a fiddle - de - dee . [Lord]2352-lord ! what a one [he]1853-the landlord was for intellect ! "[1853-the landlord]

Presently [he]1853-the landlord relaxes and leans back , and blinks through [his]1853-the landlord smoke across [the room]1421-the room at things invisible to other eyes . " Full of secrets , "[1853-the landlord] [he]1853-the landlord says . " Wonderful secrets ! "[1853-the landlord]

" Once [I]1853-the landlord get the haul of them _ [Lord]2353-lord _ ! "[1853-the landlord]

" [I]1853-the landlord wouldn t do what _ [he]1853-the landlord _ did ; [I]1853-the landlord d just well ! "[1853-the landlord] [He]1853-the landlord pulls at [his]1853-the landlord pipe .

So [he]1853-the landlord lapses into a dream , the undying wonderful dream of [his]1853-the landlord life . And though [Kemp]148-mr. kemp has fished unceasingly , [no human being]1411-no human being save [the landlord]1853-the landlord knows those books are there , with the subtle secret of invisibility and a dozen other strange secrets written therein . And [none other]1413-none other will know of them until [he]1853-the landlord dies .
